title: 100% IMPRESSED and AMAZED!! Amazing Sound and Ultra Comfortable.
text:
Verified Purchase
I was skeptical purchasing these at first. But I have to say these tiny earbuds have SUPERB sound quality. Not only do they both work simultaneously for Media, Music and Phone Calls but they can be used one at a time (independently) also which is nice for using as a Bluetooth headset for phone calls. Phone calls are CRYSTAL clear on both ends. They have an extremely low profile and do not look all big and bulky in the ear which was a huge plus as well ... Another cool thing is that they seem to fit and seal inside the ear perfectly cancelling all outside noise. It literally feels like you are in your own little world!!! Pairing literally is instant and no hassle ! The charger is also pretty nice ... Its a rubber coated round tiny charger / case wich is water resistant and TINY and doubles as a keychain =D !!! It can be charged with any MICRO USB charger which is also awesome, eliminating the need to carry an extra charger or special adapter etc. I have indeed purchased other sets for more money as well as a few others in the same price point and these are by far my favorite set now . I have literally never had a set that exceeded my expectations like these have . Perfect sealed fit, low profile, superb sound , great bass, noise canceling, crystal clear and a nice little charger as well ... NOw this leads to my last point and a really important one ... Customer service was AWESOME .. In fact I was greeted with an awesome little surprise card in the box that instructed me to contact them VIA email or facebook page to register my warranty and they actually issued me a gift card for my choice of Amazon or PayPal!!! Very cool company!!! They have my future business !!! I am going to be ordering 2 more sets !!

title: Amazing experience as always
text:
I recently purchased the BOLOXR Wireless Sports Headphones and I must say, I'm thrilled with my decision. Having been impressed with the results of their previous wired version, I was eager to try out their wireless offering. And I'm glad I did. These headphones are everything I expected from the company and more.
First and foremost, the sleek design caught my attention. They have a modern and stylish look that I absolutely love. But it's not just about aesthetics; these headphones are also incredibly comfortable. I can wear them for extended periods without feeling any discomfort or irritation.
The battery life is another standout feature. I've been using these headphones on the treadmill for about a week now, with each session lasting close to 30 minutes, and I haven't had to charge them yet. The long-lasting battery is a huge plus for me, as I don't have to worry about running out of power during my workouts.
One thing worth mentioning is that the case is a bit heavier than I expected. However, for someone like me who tends to lose things easily, this actually works in my favor. The weight makes it less likely for me to misplace the case, so I consider it a positive aspect.
Overall, I am extremely satisfied with my purchase of the BOLOXR Wireless Sports Headphones. They deliver on their promises of sleek design, comfort, and long-lasting battery life. If you're in the market for wireless headphones, I highly recommend giving these a try.

title: Wow! Just WOW!
text: It's been a couple of weeks since I've been using this product, and I can now confidently say, this is one of the best price-to-value products I've ever used. title: Amazing Bluetooth Headphones for Running
text:
I recently purchased these Bluetooth headphones, and I must say they have exceeded all my expectations! As an avid runner, finding the perfect pair of headphones that stay in place, sync effortlessly, and remain comfortable throughout my workouts has been a challenge. However, these headphones have completely changed the game for me.
The first thing that impressed me was the snug and secure fit. They come with multiple ear tips, allowing me to choose the perfect size that fits my ears perfectly. No matter how intense my runs get, these headphones stay firmly in place, eliminating any worries of them falling out or needing constant readjustments.
Syncing these headphones with my phone was a breeze. The Bluetooth connectivity is exceptionally stable, and the pairing process is almost instantaneous. No more frustrating connection dropouts during my workouts; it's just smooth, uninterrupted music to keep me motivated and focused.
Comfort is a crucial factor for me during extended runs, and I couldn't be happier with the lightweight design and soft ear tips of these headphones. Even during long-distance runs, I forget I'm wearing them, as they don't cause any discomfort or irritation.
The sound quality is fantastic, delivering clear, crisp audio with deep bass that energizes my runs. The noise isolation is impressive too, effectively blocking out distractions from my surroundings.
Overall, I highly recommend these Bluetooth headphones to any fellow runners or fitness enthusiasts. They offer an impeccable fit, seamless syncing, and unbeatable comfort, making them the ultimate companion for your workout sessions. Get ready to elevate your running experience with these remarkable headphones!

The sound quality is fantastic, delivering clear, crisp audio with deep bass that energizes my runs. The noise isolation is impressive too, effectively blocking out distractions from my surroundings. Overall, I highly recommend these Bluetooth headphones to any fellow runners or fitness enthusiasts. They offer an impeccable fit, seamless syncing, and unbeatable comfort, making them the ultimate companion for your workout sessions. Get ready to elevate your running experience with these remarkable headphones!

title: Great Headphones
text:
I ordered and received these headphones with great anticipation. Not to belittle the rest of this review, but I really like these headphones. A lot of it for reasons of personal taste as well.
Not a lot of people will be too particular about the button on the sides of them; but let me tell you, there is a big difference between having to press something very hard into your ear for it to register, and to just lightly touch it. A lot of times with more carelessly designed headphones the earbud will straight up press a sharp point into your inner ear (ouch).
These headphones have been designed to where the pressure spreads out all three your ear, and the result is that it is barely a pressure felt from using the button. Also, I preferred the precision of a button over the and precise happenstance of the touch button was features so popular now (the only reason I can see for designing them that way is that it is easier for them to be made waterproof). These also are waterproof without having to rely on that negative item.
Okay, now for the more basic stuff. The sound is very good. It’s so good to the point that I may attach them to my monitor and use them just for watching stuff online (I’m not so worried about the sound quality on watching YouTube videos and music and such). But if you want to know one thing about these headphones, you cannot ask for better sound for the price.
The battery life is fine. It does not say in the instructions or anything, but is about eight hours at maximum volume. I did not time it or anything like that. So please do your own research.
In a final analysis, these are excellent headphones for the money. I’m not sure about how many recharges in the charger container, but just by the sides of it, it should be a great deal of them.

title: My Favorite Amazon Purchase Yet!
text:
Verified Purchase
This product is PHENOMENAL. I use them for meditations, and they are great at blocking out 90% of noise, which I love. The only times noise isn’t canceled is in the case of high traffic noise and when someone is yelling to get your attention. For a closer reference, they do block out the sound of my sewing machine, which is heavy duty and rather loud so I’m very happy with them!
It does have 3 sound settings, equilibrium, vocal, and bass mode, which are all phenomenal for different reasons. I primarily use vocal mode for podcast, and bass mode for music.
I do sleep on my side, and I do move quite a bit in my sleep. Despite this, the headphones are VERY sturdy and despite my mistreatment (LOL) and ADHD brain tossing them everywhere, they are holding up like they are brand new.
I’m more than pleased with these headphones, and and especially at this price point

title: Great Bluetooth earbuds for a great price
text:
The Boloxa A17 headphones have really delivered for me. They paired easily with both my phone & laptop, and lasted over 6 hours while still having battery left. The ear hooks kept the headphones secure and the headphones were overall comfortable to wear. The audio quality was also very good. The bass was solid when listening to music, and the audio otherwise was very clear. I am very satisfied with this purchase, the headphones being waterproof is such a nice benefit to have.
Charles
5.0 out of 5 stars A17 great bang for your buck. And waterprooof.
Reviewed in the United States on July 23, 2023
They are great ear buds they are loud and the music is always crisp and clear. They fit in my ear just great and the ear hooks are what I need because air pods fall out on me. As for the microphone function it is great and I can hear the people I’m talking to and they can hear me and doesn’t sound like a tin can and eliminates much of the background noise. It has a long battery life with double led displays showing all battery strengths. I would recommend getting another pair for my family. Since my purchase I get in the car in the morning and the phone pairs to the car's audio system. When I get to work, I park the car, reach into my bag and take out either the left or the right bud, and put it in my ear. It turns on and connects immediately, with audible notifications, and the music automatically switches from the car to the bud without any button pushes. Then I just turn off the car and go. It is easy to pause the music with a single tap to the outside of the bud. The buds have other touch controls, but I never use them because the Apple Watch serves as a remote for the phone's music app. I am able to make phone calls with either bud, so each one has a mic. The iPhone automatically defaults to use the buds for calls, so I can easily receive calls by answering and hanging up using my watch or the phone itself, although there are controls that will allow one to answer and hang up using taps on the buds.. I can also use talk to text on the watch or the phone. The music automatically resumes when the mic is no longer being used. I can also summon Siri using "Hey Siri.".The case is nice but a bit bulky but nice to have wireless charging.
Battery: The battery will not make it through eight hours of continuous play, but the case charges the bud quickly and you can get a few more hours after only a 15-minute charge. I charge the case once a week, which takes 2 hours. The case also has an indicator that tells you the approximate battery life remaining on the case. It tells you the percentage of charge from what I have experienced. When the battery gets low, a voice comes on to remind you, and it is very persistent, even when you pause the music. So you really have to put the bud back in the case.
Fit: I was amazed at how well these fit. I am 5'6" and I have a small head, so I thought my ears would be too small. The buds come with size adjustment inserts, but I tried them and they didn't improve the fit. The inserts that came pre-installed worked fine. They stay in place with the ear hooks.I don't feel any discomfort after wearing them for a 10-hour shift.
Sound: I don't know much about sound quality relative to the big name brands. I know what music should sound like, and I feel that these supply a rich, balanced sound and good volume level with very little grain or background noise. I know that if I wear both buds and turn the volume up, I will be in my own little world.
Overall these buds are a great value for the price and I am looking forward to enjoying my music library at work for as long as I can.
name: Nathan A.

title: Great headphones
text:
So what’s great about these?
1. Fit perfect in the ear, especially when running or working out.
2. Price is great since I usually lose my headphones at least one a month.
3. The deep base and the noise is really rich.
4. Along with standard soft tip ear piece, the two extra pieces included are perfect for smaller ears, like my kids
5. Lastly, the battery has been better than expected. Most of my older headphones would last only a 2 hours, but these are lasting on the higher end of 6 hours continuously.
Electrical Controls Engineer
5.0 out of 5 stars BOLOXA does it again!
Reviewed in the United States on June 15, 2023
The A17 Bluetooth Headphones Stereo Sound by Boloxa has really given me a better option in headphones. Low profile while in the ear and the charging cradle is straight forward, connect it to a USB port and forget about it. I have a variety of Bluetooth headphones, from over the ear to in the ear to sports and these A17 do bring these styles into one. I enjoy switching from each style depending on the environment I'm in (office/home) and now that these A17 have a combined style I can stick to using 1 longer, especially with the long battery life. One of the major features I like about these is that each unit comes with a control button which means I can pause the music from either my left ear or the right ear and continue with the other unit. Also switching to next or previous songs while playing music is as simple as touching the correct unit. The price is right at the market value as well, I can't wait to see what they (Boloxa) have coming in the future.

title: Great, except for the mic
text:
Verified Purchase
I love these headphones! They have amazing sound and when you wear them, you can barely hear anything outside of them! I mow my lawn with then in and I barely hear the mower! The biggest problem I have experienced though is the mic. When I sit in a quiet room or in my car while it's off, the person on the other side can hear me great! But as soon as I go where there is any background noise, the mic starts picking up everything in the background and I kind of cut out pretty frequently.
If you are wanting these to work out with, or do chores with, or just to listen to anything on them, they are wonderful! But if you are wanting these for use on the phone, I would look into other products, albeit, they still work as a mic!

title: Pretty good set for the price!
text:
This set is pretty good sounding for those not wanting or unable to spend big bucks. Bought for after my surgery so I could listen to some music without disturbing others or hear their choice of tv programs. Normally use power beats pro while mowing so I gave these a shot.
Totally comfortable, little inner ear area sweating, cut out most of the mower sound (including an annoying neighbor who always tries to talk to me when I’m working).
Our three year old grandson gave them a try & sat for an hour watching his iPad which hub was grateful not to hear the same Disney movie for the 80th time! - just be sure to adjust volume on yourself first.
My only con, make sure you hold the power button off after disconnecting charger cord. Even in off slide position they connect and turn themselves on. First time I unplugged & put in case to travel I couldn’t figure out what was wrong with my phone for about fifteen minutes. Discovered it had connected to set without even being turned on.

title: GREAT DECISION!
text:
Verified Purchase
After researching & reading reviews on a number of noise-cancelling headphones (honestly, too many to count), I decided on these, & they did NOT disappoint AT ALL! For those who purchase based on reviews, keep this in mind: the handful of bad or negative reviews are usually isolated incidents &/or due to the buyer not reading the product description, therefore having misguided expectations. There are some instances where the item may get damaged in route but for the most part, if you only see a few "bad reviews" it's usually an isolated incident. title: Surprised in a good way
text:
Verified Purchase
For $30, these are an excellent pair of true wireless earphones.
Pros:
- Price is solid
- Better sound quality than expected. Definitely near the top in quality for this price bracket. Bass heavy but not excessive.
- IP68 means you can shower/bathe with these, as well as light swimming.
(Diving isn't recommended due to the signal being cut off by water)
- Comes with a total of six eartip sizes. I picked the largest for the best isolation/security of fit.
Cons:
- Only passive noise isolation, no active
- Limited button function (holding the Control button increases volume, but you need to use your phone or voice assistant to turn the volume down). Can pause, play, skip/repeat songs, and take/end/reject calls. I usually use buttons primarily for play/pause and for adjusting volume, so this is a con for me.
- Micro USB instead of USB C in 2020
Other observations:
- Charging case is relatively lightweight, and about the size of a mandarin orange
- These are definitely mid-range and bass leaning. The treble isn't terrible, but just a bit understated, especially around the mid-treble area. It'll be up to you if you're fine with this. Practically speaking, it makes these earphones better for hip hop, electronica, etc. Rock/metal sounds okay, but a lot of the guitar and vocals take a step back over bass and drums, unless it's a very high note.
- Soundstage is what you'd expect from $30 earphones, nothing impressive. That's not why you're buying these though, hopefully.
I received this pair for free for an honest review. I've tried multiple earphones in this price range as well as owning and regularly using headphones in the $300+ range, to give you context. I would recommend these to anyone looking for budget true wireless, as long as they're okay with some limited functions.

title: Nice little wireless earbuds (waterproof!)
text:
Verified Purchase
I bought these earbuds with the intention of walking on the treadmill at the gym because I was getting tire of my old wired headphones snagging on everything and getting ripped out of my ear-holes! The first thing I got to appreciate with these earbuds was the quick charging they get when placed in the magnetic holding case. The case plugs into your standard mini USB charging block that you use with your phone. In no time at all they get charged up and last multiple workout sessions before needing to be recharged, which is never a problem as I just keep the charging case plugged in all the time next to my smart watches' charging dock and put them in there when I get home for safe keeping. The sound is actually pretty good for the type of music I listen to when working out (pop and classic rock music) and get as loud as I feel comfortable with. Their wireless range stretches as far as I'd ever need it to go as I'm never more than a few meters from my phone (android). The general quality of these earbuds feels pretty high and they come with multiple rubber ear caps to match the size of ear canals that you have (small/medium/large). The instructions say you can even swim with them since they are waterproof (which I can't wait to do because it will feel so wrong but be so cool to listen to music in the water). I think I want to buy another set of these Benben buds as a gift because I like them so much and can't believe I've gone so long without something like this, and these have gotten me off to a great start!

title: Skeptical at first...
text:
Verified Purchase
- EXPECTATION: I bought these hoping to get a good set of wireless earbuds that could charge easily and quickly, not fall out of my ears, connect to my android phone no problem, and withstand water enough to shower and exercise. I literally got all of this in one package! I've had these for over two weeks and I really love them. Definitely would recommend to anyone looking for the same things.
- ACCESSORIES: The buds charge in a magnetic case that is round, small, lightweight, and portable. It comes with a braided wrist loop (optional) in case you want to attach it to a bag or something. The buds snap into place to charge, and they charge instantly and automatically when the case has some battery to it (and you charge the case via the included microUSB cable). Also, I found it super helpful because they included SO MANY earbud replacement squishies. My ears are fairly small and I imagine such an assortment of squishies could fit anyone's preferences.
- SHOWER/EXERCISE/USE: I've run with these and taken showers in these. Both buds are working as perfectly as they did the first day. I love to work in these because I don't have to worry about tripping over wires, having my phone fall out of my pocket and pulling my earbuds out, getting the wires in the sink doing dishes, or trying to aim my voice at the tiny microphone box on my old wired earbuds.
- PAIRING: Using the buttons on these is really intuitive if you've used any technology before. One click is pause, two clicks is go forward/skip, etc. Pairing is relatively easy too. I had a little trouble at first getting them to pair at the same time, but there are instructions included that address this issue. I like that when I walk outside (I only wear one bud when I'm outside so I can stay more alert to traffic) all the sound goes through the one earbud I'm using. I can leave the other earbud in its case charging at my house. No issues with this at all!
- CALLS: One time I was outside on a windy day and my sister started to call me and I was concerned that she wouldn't be able to hear me (this was the first time I was taking a call with the earbuds). Piece of cake! She heard me fine through the one earbud I was using and I didn't have to press any buttons or worry about anything.
- OVERALL: Love this product! Got so excited that I bought my brother some and he loves them too. He can lift weights now without worrying about the wires and can talk to his friends more easily. Literally the only issue with them that I have is that they're so small and convenient, I have them in all the time. And they're so compact that sometimes other people can't tell I'm wearing them! They see me apparently talking to myself like a crazy person or they'll try to talk to me and I can't hear them 'cause I'm jamming' to music :)

title: Meets Expectations- of a pair of 30$ wireless waterproof earbuds
text:
Verified Purchase
I've had them for 2-3 months, and the button on the left earbud stopped working after the first few weeks, but the sound still plays fine in both, so it's not the biggest deal. The only annoying part of that is that I can't power them both on if I don't have the case on hand because, since the left one doesn't respond to the button, it only turns on when taken out of the case because the earbuds are programmed to do that automatically.
Other than that, the sound quality has been fine, the battery life is a little hard to pinpoint, but I can say that they charge very quickly for sure, and plus the case is also a huge battery booster and it's easy to carry around. I have not submerged the earbuds, but they've survived like 70 showers with the only damage being the unresponsive button. I only have one other issue with them, and that's that the earbuds, while not uncomfortable, can be pretty loose. I don't know if it's my ears or how I turn my head, but when I'm in the shower my left ear always fills up with water that gets on the inside of the earbud, and aside from being annoying, ends up with the bud falling out. (I've always caught it when it falls; the damage to the left earbud is not a drop, it is water damage)
Sure, I have two complaints. BUT at this price point (around 30$ when I purchased) it's perfectly fine. I'd rather give four and half stars, and only take off the half-star because of the unresponsive left-earbud, but I can't. If you're looking for the cheapest pair of usable "waterproof" earbuds, these are definitely acceptable- as long as the price stays under 30$

title: Superior sound and do not fall out!
text:
Verified Purchase
All I can say is: you need to get these headphones! The quality in the design, fit, and sound is impressive.
I am always looking for the *perfect* pair of headphones that fit in my ears well, aren’t heavy, and don’t fall out after considerable wear throughout a day. I do a lot of talking throughout the day for work as well as use them for yardwork on the weekends. Every pair of headphones I seem to purchase only fits well for a short period of time and ends up falling out after talking for only 30 minutes. Enter the Beben X8 headphones!
The box comes with SIX sets of earbud tips that are sure to conform to your personal ear. This seems to always be my problem, but it’s not an issue with these headphones. In addition, the packaging contains the headphone, the charging/carry case, a (short) MicroUSB cable, and a lanyard attachment for your charging/carrying case. It is a nice compact design for easy transport or storage.
The pairing process is easy, but you first need to PULL OFF THE PLASTIC on the underside of each ear bud that protects it from the charging pins in the case. Before you charge the units or use them, make sure to do this so you aren’t frustrated after you realize it “isn’t charging.”
The sound quality is superb. The deep bass and clear audio is great for nearly any music type. Adjusting the volume is a breeze, simply hold down on the left to adjust volume down and hold down the button on the right bud to increase the volume. Want to go backward to the previous song? Just double tap the right ear bud. If you want to forward to the next song, double tap the left ear bud. Want to access your preferred Assistant? Just triple-tap the left earbud.
Pros:
-Compact design
-Great packaging that includes numerous earbuds
-Lightweight
-Stays put in your ear for extended periods of time, even when there is significant jaw movement
-Sound quality is great
-Call quality is pretty good for both callers
-Great with Zoom for conference calls!
-1 Year warranty
-Easy Pairing and setup (Android / Windows – iOS not tested)
Cons:
-No audio passthrough/amplification so you can “hear” the sounds around you
-Only able to see that the case Is charging/charged when connected to a cable by opening the case lid to view LEDs. No external LEDs
-No auto pause of audio when buds are removed from ears
Overall, I am extremely pleased with these headphones. The sound quality is far better than anticipated and they hold strong in my ears without budging. These are the real deal in terms of ergonomics and sound quality. There are a few items left to be desired as noted in my Cons list, but these aren’t deal breakers by any means. You’ll be happy you purchased these!

title: Great product
text: I honestly think anyone that gives these earbuds 1 or 2 stars is just being a hater or trying to promote another product under the guise of writing a review (this product, like every other product out there, is not 100% perfect for everyone, but it sure isn't a 1 or 2 star product, if you are honest to yourself). I use Android phones (4 of them actually, S22 Ultra, Pixel 4a 5G, Motorola Styus 5G and Revvl 6 Pro 5G) but I use Apple Airpods 3 as my go to earbuds..., why?, because they are the only open earbuds design with good sound, good microphones, lightweight comfortable design that sit best in my ear lobes without having to push anything into my ear canals and feel all that pressure in my head. If you are an Android user that wants an open ear design but don't want to shell out $140 to get good sound, good speakers and mic, lightweight (but not as lightweight as the Airpods 3 I confess) comfortable earbuds, you cannot go wrong with these earbuds.

title: Great value along with Quality for the price.
text: I bought this item (Boloxa A17) for working out, walking/biking/weight lifting. I wanted a push button control vs touch sensitive control. I have earbuds with sensitive touch control and it’s a pain to get it to work the way you want it to, this product (Boloxa A17) works and sounds great and you can easily adjust the volume up and down with ease. When needed you can also fast-forward or go back to songs with ease. The buttons on each ear piece makes it easy to control what you need it to do without the worry of trying to fumble around and push the wrong buttons. Very easy to adjust volume and change tracks on your music selection and answering and making calls. You also have two ways of charging, usb-c and wireless charging, which works great for my setup. I’ve worn these for up to 4 hours at a time with no issue as far as it hurting my ear canal or losing power. I like the way it hooks around the ear, it’s secure and I have no issues with it falling out. As for waterproof IPX67, I would say they definitely have been soaked from the use I’ve put them through including rinsing them off under the water spigot for cleaning and show no signs of failure. I would buy this product again!

title: Seamless connection to smartphone
text:
I've tried plenty of in-ear or wrap-around headphones, but these have by far been the simplest I've used. I literally took them out of the box, put them into my ears, and opened my smart phone's bluetooth menu. They made an audible "pairing" sound and were there waiting to connect within 5 seconds. With other (more expensive) pairs of headphones, I have spent minutes to hours trying to get the headphones to pair correctly, play audio out of both sides, or power on. I experienced none of those problems with these headphones. None of these features are particularly new or groundbreaking, but it is enjoyable to order an affordable pair of earphones that execute each part of the equation well.
The earphones come in a stylish, ergonomic case that leaves no confusion about how the headphones have to be placed inside in order to charge. The case fits comfortably into a purse, backpack, or even back pants pocket and also displays a few LED indicators on the inside that relay information about the charge level of each individual phone and the case battery itself. I appreciate not having to guess how much time I'll have before my headphones die, or polling their battery from within the layers-deep smartphone menu.
I also found the audio experience within multiple apps to be much easier than competitor models. I tested out and made sure that these headphones played audio by default with mobile Chrome and Firefox browser apps. They also played seamlessly with the browser version of youtube as well as the standalone Youtube app for android.
The on-ear commands are simple and not too fussy. I don't accidentally skip a track or video by errantly touching my ear, and they also have intuitive volume controls on each earphone that can be activated by a finger touch or hold. The case clasps firmly shut and has a light amount of "stick" or magnetism that keep it from being jostled open in my backpack or falling open when I take it quickly out.
The headphones themselves are a stylish black color, not too eye-catching, but subtle enough that they can be worn without drawing a lot of attention. The rubberized bulb on the end of the earpiece is an effective noise-canceller that drowned out a lot of the nearby sound without even having any audio playing. The effect is not total noise isolation, but it certainly helps music or audio to be heard more clearly. The more robust design also allows for greater in-ear volume for longer periods of time compared to smaller, stick earphones.

title: Great Quality Headphones
text:
These are a great quality pair of headphones, I have cauliflower ear and these fit just fine.
I'm able to work out with these without issue and stay on and the sound quality is crystal clear. I also really like that the battery percentage is displaying within the case that way I don't have to guess. I will continue to buy this company's product as they have done me well. The case that it comes with is a bit on the larger side but I imagine its due to the good battery life it has, I've used them for over 3 hours and still going strong. I'm a fan of the hook it has as well, that way it won't fall off when running. These are definitely earbuds for athletes or those wanting a more secure feel, I recommend these. title: Very good headphones!
text: These headphones have good style. They are lightweight but feel like they could be durable. I use many different headphones and the most common place for most to break is usually the headband. This headband feels pretty flexible. Feels like a flat metal bendable strip inside the cushioned headband. They do feel comfortable. They hug my ears a tad bit but my head is larger than average and they are lightweight so it isn't that bad. They fold and the earmuffs can be turned inward instead of outward. Probably should have been the other way so when you take them off your head and put them around your around your neck the earmuffs will lay on your chest instead of the hard exterior plastic. Haven't completely tested battery life but they advertise 70 hours and a 2 hour charge time. In my opinion, if it only does 2/3s of that it's still 2 days playtime on one charge and that's amazing! And last but not least is sound. At this price point it's great. I've paid double the price on plenty of other headphones that don't put out more sound. It also has 3 EQ SETTINGS! Vocal, pop, & bass. If you are a person that prefers to not spend much on your headphones or if you want some to gift kids these would be great! They look good, feel durable, have good sound, long battery life and won't hurt your pocket if you lose them like I've done working at a fast pace then sitting mine down and forgetting on many occasions.

title: Blown Away!
text:
Verified Purchase
Purchased as a different style earbud, have an air-pod knock-off style and was just not impressed with the fit and sound was just OK. Shipping was right on time as a prime member with accepted Covid delays. First thing I noticed when unboxing was how rugged the bbx itself was, thought to myself this is a good sign. The carrier case is just as rugged, crush proof and has a solid magnetic closure. Plugged the unit in to charge after taking off the plastic separator on the earbud charging contacts. The indicator LEDs are very nice, did not have that with the last set. The pod case has 4 indicator LEDs that flash with different notifications, you can see the charge status as well.
Once everything was ready to go, making the Bluetooth connection was easy. My phone found the device instantly and the LED indicators on the earbuds flashed blue/white as it was pairing. There is also a voice notification that you can hear when turning on/off or when connecting. I kept the instructions handy as it has a complete list of commands that involves clicking the respective buttons on each earbud. That is a real plus for me as my other set involved tapping in different locations. Once I had Spotify up and running I really was not prepared for how great these sound, unbelievable! The bass is incredible and the sound is really rich. Clicking the buttons to skip songs and turn volume up/down worked well. They seal very well in the ear and completely block out any outside noise, I can't wait to use these to mow lawn! I used them for a couple of hours at a time but have not run them long enough at a time to drain the batteries yet so I can't comment on how long they actually last. Very impressed so far, now to order a set for the wife.

title: Good for the price
text:
Verified Purchase
If, like me, you intend to use these for work, then these earbuds do the job. They do everything sufficiently well to be useful, and they cost a quarter to a fifth of what the most popular buds in the market cost. You can understand calls clearly, and music is ok. The microphone captures your voice sufficiently well. People have mentioned they could hear a minor background noise when I speak, but they could understand me fine. The charging case is also ok, albeit you should know that the buds come with a USB - C cable, and the case uses Micro USB, so you'll need to get your own charger. Luckily, all the non-Apple cellphones, speakers, and other tech gadgets up to a couple of years ago used to use Micro USB so you're likely to have a charger somewhere in your house already. Aesthetics are ok as well, the buds protrude significantly as you can see in the photos other people have posted in their reviews. All in all, I think these are good for anyone that has a very tight budget and really needs to be hands free while in phone calls.

title: Really nice with out a big price.
text:
This pair of cordless earbuds from Boloxa is one of the best I have. This pair is very comfortable around my ears. The hook is well made. The hook is soft enough for the earbuds to be worn comfortably for hours. The hook does a great job of keeping your earbuds in your ear during vigorous movement like jogging or basketball. My wife has very small ears and these earbuds were very comfortable for her to wear. She is the one that turned me on to these earbuds. These earbuds came with three sizes of soft ear cones, but only one hook.
I like that the Boloxa case tells you, with an easy to read digital display, exactly how much charge you have left. It charges quickly and works with all my wireless charging pads. It is really easy to pair with my Android phone. I used my earbuds everyday for 8 hours a day and I didn't need to charge my case for 4 days.
The box comes with the charging case, two earbuds, 3 size cone tips (one on the earbuds already), a USB to c charging cord, and a booklet of instructions. The instructions contain QR codes with videos to assist with adjusting the Android volume limits on your Android phone.
I like the sound quality and it is easy to adjust the volume with the earbuds only. The controls are simple, no need to learn morse code to advance a song or pause/play, and easy to use. They even work with only one earbud at a time.
As there is a microphone in both earbuds you can talk on the phone with only one in use. I would like to see some improvement with the microphone. My wife says this pair of earbuds sounds like I'm talking in a public bathroom, all echoes. The microphone picks up any and all surrounding noises and there is not a way to set the ambiance. It would be nice if they had an app like Sony earbuds do.
I really appreciate my wife turning me on to these. She really likes her pair of wired Boloxa U8I.

title: Overall great product
text:
Verified Purchase
If you just need a cheap pair of wireless earbuds for work, shower (Yes, shower...GAME CHANGER) working out etc...These are the way to go. The ear buds were shipped to my door step promptly the next day. Packaging and accessories included was excellent. The carrying/charging case feels solid. The magnetic lids slaps close and STAYS closed while being ruffled around in my backpack so I dont have to worry about the earbuds falling off the charger. Sound quality is surprisingly great although I wish they could be a tad louder. They stay in my ear perfectly fine with several different size ear plugs to get the right fit and noise cancellation. Operating distance while away from device that's playing is great. They have not cut out on me yet while walking away from my phone. Now...I have been through my fair share of wireless ear buds and unlike the others, they advertise that they are not only sweat resistant but WATERPROOF. So I took a shower with them to test that statement and boy these turned out to be SOLID. I even dropped one in the shower from washing around my ears and I just picked it back up, placed it back in my ear and I was back to jammin out LOL! Overall great product for the price if your not looking for a high dollar, top brand pair of earbuds.

title: A17 great bang for your buck. And waterprooof.
text:
They are great ear buds they are loud and the music is always crisp and clear. They fit in my ear just great and the ear hooks are what I need because air pods fall out on me. As for the microphone function it is great and I can hear the people I’m talking to and they can hear me and doesn’t sound like a tin can and eliminates much of the background noise. It has a long battery life with double led displays showing all battery strengths. I would recommend getting another pair for my family. Since my purchase I get in the car in the morning and the phone pairs to the car's audio system. When I get to work, I park the car, reach into my bag and take out either the left or the right bud, and put it in my ear. It turns on and connects immediately, with audible notifications, and the music automatically switches from the car to the bud without any button pushes. Then I just turn off the car and go. It is easy to pause the music with a single tap to the outside of the bud. The buds have other touch controls, but I never use them because the Apple Watch serves as a remote for the phone's music app. I am able to make phone calls with either bud, so each one has a mic. The iPhone automatically defaults to use the buds for calls, so I can easily receive calls by answering and hanging up using my watch or the phone itself, although there are controls that will allow one to answer and hang up using taps on the buds.. I can also use talk to text on the watch or the phone. The music automatically resumes when the mic is no longer being used. I can also summon Siri using "Hey Siri.".The case is nice but a bit bulky but nice to have wireless charging.
Battery: The battery will not make it through eight hours of continuous play, but the case charges the bud quickly and you can get a few more hours after only a 15-minute charge. I charge the case once a week, which takes 2 hours. The case also has an indicator that tells you the approximate battery life remaining on the case. It tells you the percentage of charge from what I have experienced. When the battery gets low, a voice comes on to remind you, and it is very persistent, even when you pause the music. So you really have to put the bud back in the case.
Fit: I was amazed at how well these fit. I am 5'6" and I have a small head, so I thought my ears would be too small. The buds come with size adjustment inserts, but I tried them and they didn't improve the fit. The inserts that came pre-installed worked fine. They stay in place with the ear hooks.I don't feel any discomfort after wearing them for a 10-hour shift.
Sound: I don't know much about sound quality relative to the big name brands. I know what music should sound like, and I feel that these supply a rich, balanced sound and good volume level with very little grain or background noise. I know that if I wear both buds and turn the volume up, I will be in my own little world.
Overall these buds are a great value for the price and I am looking forward to enjoying my music library at work for as long as I can.
name: Charles

Since my purchase I get in the car in the morning and the phone pairs to the car's audio system. When I get to work, I park the car, reach into my bag and take out either the left or the right bud, and put it in my ear. It turns on and connects immediately, with audible notifications, and the music automatically switches from the car to the bud without any button pushes. Then I just turn off the car and go. It is easy to pause the music with a single tap to the outside of the bud. The buds have other touch controls, but I never use them because the Apple Watch serves as a remote for the phone's music app. I am able to make phone calls with either bud, so each one has a mic. The iPhone automatically defaults to use the buds for calls, so I can easily receive calls by answering and hanging up using my watch or the phone itself, although there are controls that will allow one to answer and hang up using taps on the buds.. I can also use talk to text on the watch or the phone. The music automatically resumes when the mic is no longer being used. I can also summon Siri using "Hey Siri.".The case is nice but a bit bulky but nice to have wireless charging. Battery: The battery will not make it through eight hours of continuous play, but the case charges the bud quickly and you can get a few more hours after only a 15-minute charge. I charge the case once a week, which takes 2 hours. The case also has an indicator that tells you the approximate battery life remaining on the case. It tells you the percentage of charge from what I have experienced. When the battery gets low, a voice comes on to remind you, and it is very persistent, even when you pause the music. So you really have to put the bud back in the case. Fit: I was amazed at how well these fit. I am 5'6" and I have a small head, so I thought my ears would be too small. The buds come with size adjustment inserts, but I tried them and they didn't improve the fit. The inserts that came pre-installed worked fine. They stay in place with the ear hooks.I don't feel any discomfort after wearing them for a 10-hour shift. Sound: I don't know much about sound quality relative to the big name brands. I know what music should sound like, and I feel that these supply a rich, balanced sound and good volume level with very little grain or background noise. I know that if I wear both buds and turn the volume up, I will be in my own little world. Overall these buds are a great value for the price and I am looking forward to enjoying my music library at work for as long as I can.

title: Simple to pair to phone and High quality sound
text:
This is a review for the Boloxa wireless headphones A17.
My package arrived on time. I was impressed with how well the earbuds were packaged in its carrying case.
As soon as I received the A17 I carefully opened the box. I found the user manual, the charging wire, different size ear tips and the headphones in the beautiful carrying case.
The User manual is well written and easy to understand. Illustrations are great too.
Upon arrival, Earbuds appears to be charged and ready for use, but I charged the earbuds to be sure. I do like the fact that the earbuds now uses a USB – C charger. Most of the devices I own also uses USB - C charger so this makes it more convenient for me.
It was easy to pair the earbuds to my phone. No problems. And once it was paired to my phone I tried to play some tunes. It worked nicely. The sound was absolutely outstanding. Treble was great and the Bass was very good. The volume controls are simple to use. I used it for an hour for the first day and there is plenty of battery power left. I used it the following day and again still lots of batter life left again. So I can say the battery life is excellent definitely a plus cause I never remember to charge my devices..
The ear loops are great feature. They keep the earbuds in place and from falling out. This feature is very important to me. I love to exercise and other ear buds I owned without this feature were constantly falling out. In fact they were so light I almost forgot I was wearing them.
I appreciate that there are different ear tip size choices this will ensure the proper fit.
A very nice product. A feature I was not aware of at the time I purchased this A17 was the fact that it comes with a mic so I can receive calls. That is definitely a plus in my book. I thought it was just earbuds to play music while exercising or watch videos during some down time. But I am truly satisfied with this product. From the quality of sound and the ear hook feature and the simplicity of the volume up and down, all in all a great deal. The price is also a great feature too. Definitely a great value. Overall, I would highly recommend the Boloxa headphones A17.

title: BEST WIRELESS HEADPHONES FOR THE PRICE!
text:
Verified Purchase
I’ve been looking for a pair of Bluetooth earbuds for a while now that I did not have to spend a lot of money on in case I lost them.
As soon as I opened up the package, I was very surprised in a GREAT way is how small the holder was in comparison to the BOSE pair that runs just north of 300.
It’s a bit big in your pocket but I’ve traveled with these on several flights, in and out of TSA, long road trips, and they work GREAT in the gym.
I still have a love affair with full over the ear headphones but for a quick grab, go, and don’t want to have too much bulk in your bag, these are great.
Even work on my EOS R camera for listening to the audio instead of a line in pair.
The battery life is amazing, charge very fast, and pair right up to your iPhone with no issues.
I’ve never used Bluetooth for cycling however these are my new favorite earbuds for cycling for 20 to 30 miles at a time in the Arizona heat, never fell out once.
And once you have them in properly with the right fittings that are included, 90% of all the outside noise is completely gone because of how much your ears are sealed off by the outside ambient noise.
If you don’t want to spend over $100 on a pair of wireless headphones, these do a great job.

title: Great headphones for the price
text:
I chose these headphones because I was looking for a pair of comfortable wireless headphones that could fold up- and within a certain price point because I didn't have a lot to spend on a pair.
I have tried these with both my desktop computer and my iphone. The bluetooth paired easily with both and I didn't have any issues with the headphones while using. I tried out the volume and EQ buttons and all seemed to work fine so far. The sound was good and I have no complaints about that.
The only thing that I could find that may be a downer for some people is that these are not very noise cancelling. It doesn't bother me because I'm not really in a situation where that was a priority, but I can tell you that they don't offer much more noise cancelling than any typical set of on ear headphones. I wore them while using a craft cutting machine and while using an electric mower (makes noise but not as much as a gas powered) and both times could def still hear all the noise- muffled of course but I did need to increase the volume of the headphones to play over it. Like I said though for me not a dealbreaker since I was going more for price, sound and size over noise cancellation.
Overall I am happy with my purchase- no regrets

title: Bluetooth Wireless Earbuds - Great sound
text:
Verified Purchase
I like the presentation as you can see from the pictures and contents: warranty card, easy to follow directions in a foldout pamphlet, usb cable for charging and 4 sets of padded ear piece covers to fit every ear size along with the earbuds which came 3/4 charged. I used a different usb cable that was 3 feet long to charge to full charge. The wireless earbuds were charged to full within 1 hr. You have to for sure read the directions to know to take off the tiny tiny plastic cover over the charging pins on the earpiece to be able to pair to your device. Easily paired with iphone 8plus. The sound is better than another pair I already own. The sound is clear. I walked away from my device up to 30 feet without any interference or drop of quality in sound from my device. I was listening to a movie while I work remote and walked away to put something up in a closet. I have had them on now for 6 hours and still going strong on battery life. the directions say 5 hours of listening time and 70 hours of standby time. I keep waiting to hear the power low notification. The earbuds are very comfortable I tried both and then I went with just one so I can hear for other sounds in the house. The earbuds fit solid in my tiny ear canal and seals out noises around me. The quality of the sound is pretty incredible for $30 wireless earbuds. They also have a couple of iOS only directions to access siri which my others do not have this feature. Buy these I know you will not be disappointed in the quality of these bluetooth wireless earbuds. They are also waterproof so you could listen to tunes or the news in the shower. I am very pleased with my purchase

title: Gold Standard
text:
These ear buds are tied with only one other choice going forward! But both are the same store's products. Let's start with some highlights here. First they arrived quickly! Getting started using them took less than 30 seconds! Just remove them from their case, remove the clear film, turn them on with the button on the side, pressing until you see a light flash, find them listed as A17 on your device Bluetooth, and press connect! Easy! Plus they will auto reconnect to the last paired device each time they are removed from the case. Love the sound quality because it's crisp and clean while not being so loud it hurts the ears. Don't get discouraged if you like them loud though because they do pack a punch and when wearing both ear buds, if you want block all other sounds they will do just that! They stay put and you never feel like you need to readjust once they are in. I was lucky and the soft tips that came on the ear buds for me perfectly but if they don't work for you there are other sizes included! And then there is the battery... it's like the energizer, they just keep playing and playing. So while these mighty little things played for a full 8 hrs, I still didn't get the message that the battery was low! When I did charge them afterwards it was only about 1.5 hours for them to be full and the case itself holds 4-5 charges. Since you CAN opt to listen with one ear bud at a time while the other one charges, and if my calculations are correct, you could potentially listen for 16 hrs a day or more and STILL only have to recharge your case one additional time per week! Phone calls were crisp and clean with no difficulty in either party hearing the other. Comes with easy directions for how to press the left or right button to serve your needs. I have to also state that These have the large button on the face that pause/play/answer/hangup/ fast forward... does it all. Volume down on left button- long press, volume top on right button- long press... that's the only difference been the two. Takes a bit of getting used to but all in all a gentle press button that responds quickly without hurting your ear.
Awesome to use and now I'm sad... my husband wants them so I have to get more!

Don't get discouraged if you like them loud though because they do pack a punch and when wearing both ear buds, if you want block all other sounds they will do just that! They stay put and you never feel like you need to readjust once they are in. I was lucky and the soft tips that came on the ear buds for me perfectly but if they don't work for you there are other sizes included! And then there is the battery... it's like the energizer, they just keep playing and playing. So while these mighty little things played for a full 8 hrs, I still didn't get the message that the battery was low! When I did charge them afterwards it was only about 1.5 hours for them to be full and the case itself holds 4-5 charges. Since you CAN opt to listen with one ear bud at a time while the other one charges, and if my calculations are correct, you could potentially listen for 16 hrs a day or more and STILL only have to recharge your case one additional time per week! Phone calls were crisp and clean with no difficulty in either party hearing the other. Comes with easy directions for how to press the left or right button to serve your needs. I have to also state that These have the large button on the face that pause/play/answer/hangup/ fast forward... does it all. Volume down on left button- long press, volume top on right button- long press... that's the only difference been the two. Takes a bit of getting used to but all in all a gentle press button that responds quickly without hurting your ear. Awesome to use and now I'm sad... my husband wants them so I have to get more!

title: Quality and comfort at an affordable price
text:
I am not sure if I am like many people, but I have trouble finding a set of earbuds that I can use without them falling out of my ears. Maybe the holes in my ears are larger than most people but most earbuds fall out even if I cram them in, to the point they are uncomfortable, they end up coming out. I have had more success with over the ear headphones but the only ones I tried were wired. I have been looking for a quality set or wireless over the ear headphones that provide quality sound and won’t break the bank. I have found just that in the Boloxa A17 headset. When first opening the package, you can tell there has great care taken with this product. The packaging alone has the feel one would come to expect from much pricier products. The headset has a sleek design and are lightweight. The included instructions are clear and well thought out to show the use of all the features of the Boloxa A17 headset. I love the convenient features of this headset. Here are few noticeable features
• They turn on when you take them out of the case and turn off when you put them back in.
• They also stay in my ears comfortably and reliably no matter what angle my head may be in they stay snug and comfortable
• The case has wireless charging capability that works quite well. No need to reposition precisely in one location on a pad
• The buttons for control are large and easily useable even with large fingers.
• There is a charging indicator light on the outside of the case so you can tell it is charging and uses USB-C so I can use the same cable as my phone to charge them.
• The battery life of this headset it amazing. The case provides charge boost when not in use and a single case charge lasts for days.
If you have been looking for a quality over the ear wireless headset, I recommend you give these a try. I am quite certain you won’t be disappointed.

title: Perfect Upgrade
text:
Verified Purchase
I am an audiophile and am almost constantly listening to audiobooks and podcasts. I had a couple of separate earbuds similar to these before but they eventually died, broke, or I lost them. I was looking for a replacement and this definitely is what I was looking for.
I love the charging case which is also waterproof. This keeps me from losing the earbuds and makes sure they are always charged. The waterproofing prevents me from worrying about it. The case is small enough to fit in a pocket. It is a smidge bulky but not too bad.
The earbuds are great as well. I use them separately as I like only using one at a time. I tried another earbud set with touch activation rather than a button, but the problem with those is they were too sensitive and would be activated by hair, accidental brushes, and water in the shower. These earbuds have a button so it is very hard to accidentally turn it on. I also love how they turn on a pair just by removing from the case and power off when you replace them. This is great as I don't have to manually turn them on or off and can just pop them into my ear.
These earbuds were exactly what I was looking for and are at a better price than many comparable products. I would highly recommend if this sounds like what you are looking for.

title: Looks and sounds good
text:
These earbuds are truly impressive and I have used quite a few. The design in black is sleek and modern, making them quite the stylish accessory. What's particularly good is their ability to stay securely in place during sports activities or while commuting on a bus or bike – a practical feature for us on-the-go folks.
The sound quality is quite exceptional, thanks in part to the ear tips that effectively block out ambient noise, elevating the overall music experience. The design choice to offer extra support behind the ears results in a slightly larger case, which is easily forgiven once you realize it supports wireless charging. Charging convenience is always a plus, right?
In conclusion, I can confidently recommend these earbuds. If you're a fellow enthusiast of running or active lifestyles, these earbuds could be your perfect companions. They strike a fine balance between style, functionality, and great sound.

title: Hard to beat for the money.
text:
Verified Purchase
*I received a complimentary set of earbuds for review*
At first listen, I was fully prepared to submit a very unfavorable review on these earbuds. They sounded horrible (over-emphasized highs and very little bass), and they would NOT stay in my ears. I was searching for positive things to say about them just to soften the blow. BUT...
...then I realized that it wasn’t the fault of the earbuds. Operator error was the culprit! It turns out that all I needed to do was to make sure to properly insert the earbuds, with the body oriented up, not down. It made all the difference in the world. Now I hear much more balanced sound, and the earbuds are safely nestled in my ears. The question now is whether you will trust the rest of my review, since I am clearly a dolt.
I’ve used these for several days now, just to be sure of how I feel about them. The packaging was good (although the packing consisted of putting the nicely done product box into a much larger box with nothing done to ensure that it didn’t bounce around in transit). The charging/carry case is nice, and the ‘buds charged with no issue. Pairing was simple, the way pairing should be, but so often isn’t. I have not had a single instance of my audio cutting out.
Directions aren’t the best - as you can see even from the description and details provided by the vendor here on the product page, they could stand a little more work on their translation capabilities.
Back to the sound. I’ve given them 4 stars. Do they compare with my personal wired earbuds, or with my wired or wireless headphones? Well, no. But then, would I really expect these very inexpensive earbuds to be able to compete with something costing 5 to 10 times more? For the price, the sound is pretty damn good. Plus, I can use these in the shower with no issues whatsoever. I can’t say that about any of my other earbuds or headphones.
For the money, these are going to be tough to beat. Easy to use, very functional and decent sound.

title: Impressed with 99% of the headphones.
text:
So I bought these not really having any idea of what to expect.
When I opened up the box with thr headphones I honestly had 2 things that were a dissapointment. The audio cable is about 3' too short and the USB charging cable is really short too.
The USB cable being short prevents me from setting the headphones on top of my desktop. I have a power backup under my desk so wire length is important.
Other than that they are incredibly comfortable, they don't put pressure on your ears.
The sound quality is, in my opinion, is really good. I use these for gaming* and it is noce to have headphones that the sound quality makes it easier to distinguish where something os coming from.
* I typically play Zombie Horde games so hearing is everything.

title: Even better than I expected.
text:
The Boloxa Wireless Sports headphones arrived just a few days after I placed the order. The box it came in was well packaged, and it had a complete user manuel with all the information, warnings and instructions, and the entire thing was in English. Some product inserts have very little information, and they are in so many different languages, there isn't space to say much in English, so I really appreciated having an entire printed booklet come with the headphones. After reading the instructions and taking them out of the box, I turned them on and they paired immediately with my iPhone. I tested the volume of both speakers, and I could only turn it up about halfway as the sound is so good and clear that any higher would have been too loud.
The appearance is very sleek, and though I have never owned earbuds/headphones that wrapped around the ear, I was delighted by how comfortable they were to use, despite having a number of ear piercings (see photo). I went about my day, enjoying listening to music and videos while I did laundry and washed dishes. Despite being used for several consecutive hours, the battery remained mostly full. When I placed them back in the case, they were charged to full again in less than an hour. Awesome! When I ordered these headphones, I didn't expect to love them as much as I do, which is somewhat unfortunate for me, as I have already promised them to my 21 year old son. Ah well, I guess I can always order another set for myself, and at the current price of $29.99 I feel they are very good value for money. I have already owned a set of earbuds from this company for some time (they look like airpods), so I know they make good, quality products that last. I absolutely recommend these earbuds to anyone looking for good value for their money, and who wants a product that will last. Five stars, all the way!

When I placed them back in the case, they were charged to full again in less than an hour. Awesome! When I ordered these headphones, I didn't expect to love them as much as I do, which is somewhat unfortunate for me, as I have already promised them to my 21 year old son. Ah well, I guess I can always order another set for myself, and at the current price of $29.99 I feel they are very good value for money. I have already owned a set of earbuds from this company for some time (they look like airpods), so I know they make good, quality products that last. I absolutely recommend these earbuds to anyone looking for good value for their money, and who wants a product that will last. Five stars, all the way!

title: not the best, not the worst
text:
Verified Purchase
I knew based on how much money I was spending on these, that they weren't gonna be top quality or anything. So I'm not gonna go and say that these are garbage or anything like that, I'll just give my experience with them. I do like that they come with many sizes of cushion pieces to put in your ear, especially because my right ear needs a different size than my left. The battery life is pretty decent, but could be better. I'd say the headphones themselves last around 4-5 hours. The case's battery life is meh, not as great. Fairly comfortable, they do ache after a while but I think that just may be any earbud for me. Sometimes they just cut out randomly, like they'll stay connected but I'll have no sound. It's happened during my online therapy sessions, and when that happens, I can't hear her and even if I disconnect my earbuds and use my internal microphone on my laptop, she still can't hear me. But overall, these are decent headphones and for what I paid, I'm not that upset. If you're looking for bluetooth headphones on the cheap, I'd recommend these. But if you're willing to spend a little extra, maybe find something else.

title: Immediate review
text:
Verified Purchase
I just unboxed these a half hour ago and was very excited for them. I have trouble keeping normal earbuds in my ears, let alone wireless ones but I was pleasantly surprised that they came with a piece small enough and it fits comfortably. (I also have tics in which I shake my head a lot, and they stayed in!!)
Sound quality is good from what I can tell, and it seems to cancel a lot of noise from around me.
The one thing that is bothering me is the infidelity of the connection. I will be listening to music for a minute and it'll be fantastic; smooth, clear, balanced... and then it starts to cut in and out for indefinite amounts of time.
I haven't seen anything about the connection once they are paired, so maybe I just got a defective pair? I will have to play around with them more and I'll update if anything changes.
Update:: I've had them for a few hours now and have messed around with them to find that the bluetooth connectivity issue was my phone (I have an old Galaxy Prime J7 whatever the heck you call it and it constantly gives me trouble with everything I do). I have them connected to my computer (playing the same music as before) right now and can hear it clearly and listen to it when I am two floors apart from my computer.
After figuring this out, the product went from 2 to 4 stars. I wish there was more I could do to fix the issue with my phone, but it is nothing the manufacturer did wrong/could do

title: Bluetooth Earphones
text:
I’ve been staying away from bluetooth earphones because they didn’t last long. Supposedly, the battery on this one is supposed to last at least 70 hours. Ok, so I decided to try it when 2 of my plugin earphones broke within about a month of each other.
First, it arrived already charged so you can use it, although I wasn’t sure how long the charge was, so I charged it a little longer.
Easy to set up with any bluetooth electronics. It’s nice and portable, not like the bigger ones I’ve seen around. Folds up for compact travel and lightweight. The charger is USB-C.
It does come with an audio line just in case, which is ideal and I like that you have that option.
As for sound, it sounds like any other earphone I have had, but I did hear the bass sounds a little more prominent in the music I was listening to.
All of the controls are on the right side of the earphones. Inside the phones is an “L” or “R” to let you know which side is which. It does take a moment to figure out how all of the buttons work, as some of them have more than one function. For example, the volume buttons are also the forward buttons, depending how long you hold them down.
The equalizer is very elementary sounding. The vocal mode just sounded like more treble. Pop mode sounded more blended and I really couldn’t tell the difference in the bass mode. Maybe someone with a better musical ear can explain if there are differences.
It doesn’t matter to me. I just wanted a pair of earphones so I can go around my place and not worry about a line, but also not worry about the bluetooth dying quickly. It is pretty comfortable to wear, but I was concerned that it is smaller than my other ones. The size wasn’t a problem for me.
I didn’t realize it, but according to the description, there is a microphone attached so you can use the earphones for your phone. I haven’t tried it yet because I really don’t see myself using it, but I’m glad it’s there just in case.
The range is pretty good. I passed through a building 35 feet long, and forgot to take the phones off. I could still hear whatever I was listening to, without any interruptions, which was pretty cool.
They pretty much thought of everything.
I think for the price, it’s pretty good. Nothing fancy, just enjoyment.

title: Great value
text:
Verified Purchase
My Win 11 desktop computer was having issues with freezing when watching video or participating in online meetings. I traced it down to something USB: New hub, new headset, etc. Nothing worked. So, I tried my fancy Bluetooth headset and voila, everything seems to be working fine. Purchased these as for home use, other is for travel. Pairing was trivial, sound quality is decent enough, sound modes are interesting but not astonishing. Battery lasts all day, and it also works when connected to a charger. Controls on the headset work as expected once you figure out how to find them by touch. No noise cancellation, but that's not what I purchased and certainly not for this price. The foam ear cushions keep out most ambient anyway, and the microphone has not upset any of my clients when in meetings with them. I'd buy them again.

title: Convenient wireless charging
text:
These headphones have great sound quality for the price. Do not expect audiophile level sounds, but for the average user these headphones sound great! They fit snugly in the ear and even include different ear tips in case you need a different size. The sports wing tips that go around your ear make these super convenient for exercising since you know the headphones will not pop out of your ear like some other headphone brands that only barely stick in your ear. I was looking for a solution since my previous pair of Bluetooth headphones would fall off when I’m working around the house and I didn’t want to have to deal with something around the neck that feels heavy or gets in the way.
I also appreciate the buttons on both headphones that allow some more intricate controls (you can go to the previous track using your left ear instead of having to press at least 3 times – which with my previous headphones I feel like never registers correctly.) Additionally, it’s nice since you can pair each headphone separately if needed in mono mode and still control it with a button on either. I like to do this when working around the house or at a coffee shop so I can hear family or friends if they are calling for me.
Lastly, the headphones case is a great upgrade for me. I love the display that shows how much battery you actually have left instead of having to guess or just always plugging it in – it also shows you if the headphones are charging or not which is convenient. Lastly, the best part is that the case can wirelessly charge now! I’m sick of every new electronic needing a new cable and having to keep track of all of them or use up my phone charging cable – nice to be able to just set it on a wireless charger and leave it there!

title: better than my Sony headphones
text:
I bought these headphones for my daughter, who would listen to music 24/7 if she could.
After charging (her device said they were only 90% charged, despite being fully charged according to the instructions and light on the headphones), we connected them to her Samsung tablet. Very easy to connect through bluetooth. I say this after multiple headaches with my own Sony bluetooth headphones.
The aux cord is great, so she can listen to music through her Echo Dot. I knew going in that these would not connect wirelessly to her Echo Dot, but, with the cord, they're perfect. She just has to sit and listen, which is fine when she's drawing and painting.
I wanted to make sure the sound quality was good. I only partially trusted the reviews I read prior to purchase. The sound quality is AMAZING. I feel like she got a better pair of headphones than I did, and I own some $200-something Sony headphones.
The volume buttons on her headphones literally control the volume on the device, unlike some volume control buttons when you're connected through bluetooth. We watched the Samsung dial go up and down as we pressed the buttons. (We're easily amused.) The headphones also have a play/pause button and an EQ button.
We bought the blue/gold version and it's so pretty! These headphones have surpassed our expectations for $30. Maybe they'll last longer than her earbuds typically do.

title: They stay where they are supposed to in your ear!
text:
I may have odd shaped ears because up until I received the A17 model, I've never been able to wear earbuds and have them stay in place in my ear. Especially when I exercise, which is primarily when I wear the earbuds. In addition to not moving in my ear, the next thing I noticed was the sound quality. Very impressive! I'm not an expert but we all know when something sounds either good or off just a bit. These sound good at both ends of the scale. I used to travel every week for years and at the time I purchased a pair of very expensive noise cancelling over the ears head phones. They worked wonderfully for years, until one day they just quit working. I can't say the A17's work as well as the over the ear model I wore on an airplane (because I have no plans to be on an airplane) but they seem to work as well in the gym where there is always background noise.
Overall I'm very impressed with the quality, both sound and fit, and would highly recommend the A17 Headphones. Especially for the price! They are comparable to my old over the ear model that cost over ten times as much!
Thanks for reading, Don

title: Excellent earbuds!!!!!!
text:
Verified Purchase
I loved these earbuds for months, and still do! Excellent sound quality, easy connection, just wonderful! I loved them so much I bought my boyfriend a pair immediately, and boy have they been helpful as we both worked from home during the pandemic! The charging case is brilliant, and I love how they turn on/off automatically when you take them out or put them in the case. I bought them for running, and they were excellent! I wear them frequently with a mask and they don’t feel uncomfortable at all, nor do they fall out when taking on/off the mask.
My reason for 3 stars though..... the battery life was previously amazing, I felt like I could use these for so long and they wouldn’t die! The charging case was awesome too as I stated above. However, after using them for about 2 months, the charging case stopped charging them. Sometimes I’d plug them into the PLUGGED IN fully charged case, and they still wouldn’t charge. I’d find out randomly that my earbuds were on (and using charge) in the case, therefore making my phone only play sound through Bluetooth. This is when I manually turned them off before plugging them in as well. Just super annoying, and definitely not something I should have to replace two months later. I contacted the company and after several messages that were difficult to understand, they agreed to send me replacements. If I receive a replacement and the charging issue was a one time thing, I will definitely edit my review!
*****Edit 8/8/20.... I received my replacements in two days! They are EXCELLENT and I was pleased to see they now take a USB-C charger! This means basically nothing to me but my techie boyfriend says it’s a major upgrade :face_with_tears_of_joy: I see no issues with the charging case at all in this new pair so I think my other pair was just a fluke! I’ve used these nearly all day and they’re still going! :clapping_hands_light_skin_tone: Definitely buy these earbuds, one of the best buys of 2020 for me, even with the charging case issue!

title: This bud's for you!
text:
Verified Purchase
These are the best BT earbuds yet for my iPhone. They give true, excellent, binaural sound, and turn on and connect immediately as soon as you take one or both out of their charging case. You can use one or both, take them into the shower, switch ears with the same earbud--the R and L, while marked, seem to be angled the same.
Pairing was seamless--I just turned on BT in iPhone--no buttons to push. There are 3 sizes of ear cushions, and the fit (in my ears, anyway) is good, and they are comfortable.
I've been through far too many "waterproof" earbuds, what with poor battery times, need for USB plug-in charge, no charging case, mediocre sound quality. These are by far the best.
Interesting question as to whether they are better than the Apple AirPods (Plus), price not withstanding. There's no noise cancellation option, unless I've missed it. They work fine w Siri. There's no magnetic charging option, but with the long battery life of the charging case, it's hardly necessary. The charging case is a bit bigger than that of the AirPods.
Bottom line--for about 1/6 of the now widely available discounted price of the AirPods Plus, I would seriously consider these as my primary earbuds if you don't need the adjustable noise cancellation feature, magnetic charging, and some of the other iPhone-specific features of the AirPods.
