title: Good bass, solid build quality, nice assortment of accessories
text:
Verified Purchase
I got these as a pair of headphones to use in the gym and as general around-town beaters. Shipping was overnight (hooray Amazon Prime!). The packaging felt very solid, everything was secure and in great shape. A charging/storage case was provided, along with a carrying strap. Additionally, a nice array of high-quality tips were provided, making it easy to find a size/shape that fit my ears. The case is high quality with a nice weight, lid closure is magnetic and the earbuds slide easily into place and are secured by magents. A charging cable is provided (although you have to provide your own wall-adapter if desired). Documentation/instructions are present and clear although some of the syntax/English is not perfect.
Initial impression of the build quality is high - the earbuds feel solid, yet light. They each have a single button on them that has a variety of context-aware functions, although it is a bit off that you have to use one headphone to go to the next track and the other to go backwards.
First thing I noticed while listening to them is how bass-forward they are. They provided a surprisingly defined and present low-end that I did not expect from their size and price-point. This does come at the cost of mid-range definition (I found the mids to be somewhat suppressed / muddied) and some high-end harshness.
Overall some of the things that I liked: the price, the amount/quality of the low end, variety of accessories, pairing was easy, earbuds turn on/off when taken out/put into the charging case.
Some of the things I didn't like: Physical buttons (compared to touch-interfaces present on other higher-end headphones like Galaxy Buds) meant that to change tracks I was jamming the earbuds into my ears, the oddly loud voice instructions / notifications that are built in.
These earbuds surprised me at their price of ~$30. I think that they are a great product for people looking for water-resistant earbuds for the gym that will pump out some good motivational soundtracks. They don't stand up to some of their more-expensive competition in terms of sound quality, user-interaction, and comfort but they do great for the price

title: Great sound for the price
text:
Verified Purchase
My son needed some headphones so he can use them at school while he is doing his school work (Teachers allow the use of headphones while doing classwork). He wanted something that was noise cancelling because sometimes the kids in his class get a little too loud. I started searching for something that would give me more bang for my buck without stressing my pocket book. Came across these and read the reviews and decided to give them a try.
My son has been using these for a few days and he is stoked about them. These headphones are sturdy and do not feel cheap. All the buttons work and don't feel fragile. My son says that they have a long battery life (he runs them all day pretty much) and that they are comfortable on his head and ears. I'm not 100% sure if these are noise cancelling, but my son says when he has them on and has his music playing, that is all he hears.
When it comes to Kids and headphones sometimes it's better to get a good cheaper pair rather than paying hundreds of dollars on something that could get broken, lost or stolen. Would definitely buy these again. May get a set for myself for the gym.

title: Best wireless buds I've owned so far...
text:
Verified Purchase
I was looking for something that didn't look like I had a growth protruding from my ear and had decent sound quality with a bit of noise cancellation and these fit the bill.
The charging situation with these is great. The lanyard allows me to simply connect the charging container to the zipper of my work bag and lets it hang in my bag. Very sturdy charging container. I have zero concerns about it hanging in my back and taking the constant movement. I keep a charging block in my back that I simply connect via USB and charge them like a phone. No need to even move the thing from my bag.
The buds themselves are well constructed and easy to use once you get used to the operation.
Connectivity works great with my Android phone and I haven't had a single problem with them in any way.
Very solid. Sound great. I would certainly buy these again.
I use them mainly for driving to work and back. Sometimes I use them with my Windows 10 desktop but they have the ordinary bluetooth range so I can't really walk around the house with them because the walls will interfere with the signal... but that's an inherent bluetooth limitation.
Battery life is pretty good for my use. I drive about 15-20 minutes one way and I don't need to charge them but maybe once a week. I turn them off when I get to work and when I get home.
They fit snug and do not irritate my typically sensitive ears. Some earbuds, wireless or not, tend to make my inner-ear area sensitive and sore... and these do not do that.
I would recommend these to anyone looking for a decent pair of BT wireless earbuds. In fact I might look for this brand when I search for other audio products. I've never heard of Beben before but I'd buy other products from them if I happen across anything they make when shopping for other items.
They won't necessarily blow you away but they are more impressive than what I thought I was going to get and for that I am grateful.

The charging situation with these is great. The lanyard allows me to simply connect the charging container to the zipper of my work bag and lets it hang in my bag. Very sturdy charging container. I have zero concerns about it hanging in my back and taking the constant movement. I keep a charging block in my back that I simply connect via USB and charge them like a phone. No need to even move the thing from my bag. The buds themselves are well constructed and easy to use once you get used to the operation. Connectivity works great with my Android phone and I haven't had a single problem with them in any way. Very solid. Sound great. I would certainly buy these again. I use them mainly for driving to work and back. Sometimes I use them with my Windows 10 desktop but they have the ordinary bluetooth range so I can't really walk around the house with them because the walls will interfere with the signal... but that's an inherent bluetooth limitation. Battery life is pretty good for my use. I drive about 15-20 minutes one way and I don't need to charge them but maybe once a week. I turn them off when I get to work and when I get home. They fit snug and do not irritate my typically sensitive ears. Some earbuds, wireless or not, tend to make my inner-ear area sensitive and sore... and these do not do that. I would recommend these to anyone looking for a decent pair of BT wireless earbuds. In fact I might look for this brand when I search for other audio products. I've never heard of Beben before but I'd buy other products from them if I happen across anything they make when shopping for other items. They won't necessarily blow you away but they are more impressive than what I thought I was going to get and for that I am grateful.

title: Does what it promises and afforable
text:
Verified Purchase
These earbuds have a lot of features and seem to be of great quality, so at its price point it is a steal.
The Good:
- Affordable compared to other wireless earbud competitors
- I'm no audiophile, but the sound quality is perfectly satisfactory for me
- Raised multi-purpose button on each earbud, allowing a combination of presses for all sorts of instructions (volume control, song selection, power, play/pause, phone calling, etc).
- Range is as advertised. Tested at around 15 feet with no real disruption.
- The charge case is a great inclusion
- Includes 3 different sizes of earbud caps to suit your comfort
- Bluetooth pairing was painless
- Design looks fine
The bad:
- It doesn't "feel" as secure as I would like it to, but in reality it does stayin my ears just fine with movement. I find that the best way to put it in is to twist it into my ear canal, as opposed to trying to push straight in (the pressure wall won't allow it). I think I'll just get used to this.
- The volume controls are slowwww. You have to continue to hold either the left/right earbud button down for a second until it begins to raise/lower the volume slowly in increments, and then you let go when acceptable. You can imagine this is frustratingly longer than having an option that raises/lowers volume with discrete button presses.
- When you perform an action with the earbud buttons, there is a voice that announces your action. WHAT??? So everytime I skip to the next song or go back, I hear this stupid "FORWARD" or "REVERSE". It is absolutely ridiculous and the fact there isn't an option to disable this is even worse. What kind of respectable music player would do this? However, this is fixable with a firmware update so here's hoping they address this in the future.
name: S C

title: Very comfortable, all-purpose earbuds
text:
I have been enjoying my new earbuds doing all kinds of activities for the past couple of weeks and I am truly impressed. These little guys not only meet but exceed my expectations in every aspect, making them a worthy investment for anyone looking for an inexpensive all-purpose pair of earbuds.
First, the sound quality of these earbuds is simply remarkable. Compared to my previous favorite headphones, these have a little extra goodness for my listening enjoyment. The bass is deep and resonant, while the treble is crisp and clear. Whether I’m listening to my favorite songs/podcasts, watching movies, or even taking phone calls, the audio quality is consistently impressive. The awesome L-to-R stereo sounds brings me back to the first time I heard AC/DC and Styx on my Sony Walkman.
Comfort is an important factor for me, and I'm pleased that these earbuds excel in this department. They come with two tip sizes, ensuring a snug fit. I use them as they came out of the box and have not experienced any discomfort. The lightweight design and sleek shape make them easy to wear while relaxing at home, working out, or running - without worrying I might drop one. They are also sweat and water-resistant.
They effortlessly work well with all my Bluetooth devices and the connection remains stable even from 10+ feet away, like when I run out to check the mail. The touch controls make it easy to adjust the volume, skip tracks or answer calls without reaching for my phone. And I really like the automatic reconnection when I take them out of the case.
Battery life is another area where these earbuds excel. With a single charge, I am able to enjoy hours of use. The charging case shows the % of life, fits well in my small purse and provides additional power when I can’t plug in.
With exceptional sound quality, comfort, connectivity, battery life, and low price, these definitely surpassed my expectations. They have certainly been a huge part of my daily routine, and I recommend them to anyone seeking a new pair or to give as a gift.

title: Great product, but didn't meet my needs.
text:
Verified Purchase
The quality of these headphones are great depending on what your plan is for their use. The sound quality was stellar and they fit in the ears nicely. I purchased them to wear to bed to help me fall asleep. They paired great with my phone and I though they are a little large for a side sleeper, I felt these were going to be much better than the corded ear buds I had. I charged them up so they would be ready. The first night, they were great! The battery lasted all night. I didn't recharge them before going to bed the second night because they had been in their case all day and the case itself had a charge so I thought I was fine. The second night, I was woken up by them saying LOUDLY (much louder than I had the volume set for) in my ear "BATTERY LOW", then a few minutes later "POWERING OFF". Well, that was a rude awakening so I thought my solution was to charge them up before going to bed. The next night, same thing.. but worse. Each ear bud yelled in my ear on separate timelines. First the right ear, battery low! Powering off! Took that one out and put in the case. The left one was still playing music so I felt I was fine. NOPE! About 10 minutes later, BATTERY LOW, POWERING OFF! Not sure why I didn't just remove them both after the first time they yelled at me. Hubby was still snoring so I was hoping they would just shut off instead of announcing their departure? Who knows. Anyway, boxed them up for a return the next morning.
If your plan is to wear these while awake for bluetooth ear buds. You absolutely can't go wrong with this purchase... they are great. But they are not great for sleep. I had asked this question prior to ordering but didn't get a response before I placed the order. The response I got only said that they aren't good for sleep. Well, some people feel it is not good to sleep in earbuds or to keep them in your ears for an extended period of time, so with the review giving no explanation as to why, it wasn't very valuable. This review is my why they are NOT GOOD FOR SLEEP.

title: Unparalleled Wireless Listening Experience with Impressive Playtime
text:
The standout feature of these headphones is undoubtedly their astounding 70 hours of playtime on a single charge. This unrivaled battery life has transformed the way I enjoy music and podcasts, as I can go days or even weeks without having to worry about recharging. This feature is particularly advantageous for travelers, workdays, and long journeys, making these headphones an ultimate companion for extended entertainment.
The audio quality delivered by these headphones is nothing short of phenomenal. The deep bass, crisp mids, and clear highs create a captivating soundscape that elevates every listening experience. The inclusion of three EQ modes further enhances the versatility of the headphones, allowing you to tailor the audio profile to match your preferences, whether you're enjoying immersive music, taking calls, or diving into work-related tasks.
The over-ear design of these headphones envelops the ears in plush comfort, providing an exceptional listening experience even during prolonged use. The foldable and lightweight construction adds to their portability, making them easy to pack for travel or store in between uses. The design strikes a perfect balance between modern aesthetics and ergonomic comfort.
The wireless Bluetooth connectivity of these headphones ensures freedom of movement without compromising on audio quality. The pairing process is straightforward, and I've experienced consistent and reliable connections with various devices. The integrated microphone is a valuable addition, allowing seamless transition from music playback to hands-free calls.
These headphones are designed to cater to a wide range of needs such as working, traveling, exercising, or simply relaxing at home, they adapt effortlessly to different scenarios. The foldable design, coupled with the included travel pouch, adds to their portability, making them an ideal choice for those constantly on the go.

title: Have two pairs of these... honest review
text:
Verified Purchase
Update as of March 2021:
Support did end up following up a few days later, with a few other suggestions regarding troubleshooting the charging issue. I tried them for a few more days and gave up. Support followed up and we’re very kind to send another pair which were delivered within 48 hours. They very understanding and patient during this whole process - I’ve since upped my review to four stars. At this price point you do get what you pay for, however, excellent customer service is very hard to come by these days! If anything, I now know a few different approaches on how to address certain issues that may come up should they third pair act up. I use them frequently and have tried numerous models within the same price point, these so far are my go to pair. I highly recommend following the instructions on applying for their warranty if you are considering purchasing these.
——
I’m on my second pair.
I’ll try to keep this short, these are good for the price (under 20$). These work great in a pinch. Pair nicely with iphone, sound is okay nothing mind blowing. They charge relatively quickly, my only gripes with these is that if you use these relatively frequently they will no hold a charge or one bud will eventually fail to either hold a charge, charge at all, or turn on fully. I didn’t apply for the three year warranty through Beben with my first pair. I applied with my second, within about a month one bud started acting out as I described above, and I emailed support which were helpful in giving instruction on how to ‘reset and revive’ the bud. However, all four now won’t hold a charge for more than 2-8 minutes each after being charged for over 24 hours... support has magically ghosted me for the time being and are not responsive since feb 18th, 2021. Hoping to either get a refund or another pair. Don’t purchase these for over $20.

title: Great Sounds! Lightweight and Cool Design,
text:
This set of Bluetooth Headphones is easily one of the best I've ever come across, and here's why:
* Overall Impression: this headset comes in BLACK that exudes class & quality like a tuxedo or black limousine. It's shaped perfectly around my head & ear contours, it's so cool looking:red_exclamation_mark::red_exclamation_mark:
* Sounds: this sub-$100 Bluetooth Headset measures up with all the more famous brands, it covers all dynamic ranges equally well from trebles to bass, I was blown away:red_exclamation_mark:
* Noise Cancellation: With ANC 918 certified, this blocks away those annoying ambient noises, like crying babies on the airplane, or crowd noises on the subway, or while in office, coworkers chatting away while attempting to work:red_exclamation_mark:
* > 1 BT Connectivity: I've never had one that permits my BT headset to connect to two devices at the same time! This means I can talk on my cellphone, and listen to music originating from my tablet, or any other Bluetooth-capable devices! This is amazingly convenient, as I no longer need to disconnect one in order to connect to another! WOW:thumbs_up:
* Long Playtime: nearly 20+ hours on a single charge
* Lightweight: this thing weighs merely just over 1 lb, it's incredibly comfortable :red_exclamation_mark:
* Value: all of the above for about $50, C'MON now

title: CHANGED PRODUCT
text:
Verified Purchase
**EDIT: this listing has completely changed from what it was when I bought it. The original headphones were not airpod ripoffs, they were a genuine great product that I was paid to review, just for them to change the product to rip off apple and you.**
**I received this product for free. This offer is no longer available for amazon customers. **
I have been using airpods for about a year now and love the convenience that they bring. However, my ear shape allows them to fall out when working out, which can be a real problem. In come these headphones.
Pros:
Great sound quality. Definitely better than the airpods as expected since these are in-ear headphones.
Great array of included tips for headphones.
Good battery life with LED's on each bud to show if they are on (these only flash when charging/pairing)
Case battery has 5 LED's to show current charge status. This is a nice welcome feature, as it allows me to quickly see how much charge I have at the beginning of the day rather than having to keep a pod in the case and open my phone to see the battery life, which is the case for the airpods. The airpods will give me a "almost dead" orange light but that's not as descriptive as these ones.
Noise cancellation is pretty good thanks to the custom fitting of the tips.
PRICE! These things are easily worth the 30 dollars. If I had to guess, I would've put these at a 70-80 price range.
Cons:
cheap and short included USB micro cable. I would have liked to see USB type C.
Case is a little large. I like to keep my airpods in my pocket, but the profile of the case is too big to make it comfortable for keeping in my jeans' pocket. There is an included strap, but I never have been a fan of these solutions.
I seriously recommend these. For the price, I was concerned they would be cheap, but I would have rather had these than spend the money on the airpods. My biggest fear was the lack of convenience that these would bring compared to the apple solution. However, outside of the standard bluetooth pairing, the experience is the same. Apple allows you to just open the case and they connect- these require you to initially set them up through settings. However, once that is done, taking one or both out of the case will instantly sync them up. You can take just one out of the case and use it, which is what I do, and the other will continue charging. Love these and will continue to use them instead of my airpods when working out or working at my desk.

title: Very comfortable, secure, and budget friendly.
text: Let me start off by saying that I am a 72 year old man who is moderately functional with technology. I have always had a problem with earbud type headphones. They either fall out easily or do not usually feel comfortable. As a result I have always used over the ear headphones. During Prime Days I came across some earbud type blue tooth headphones at a great price and decided to give them a try. I really liked them. They fit well and were more comfortable than the over the ear set I have when listening for a long period of time. I still had a concern about them coming out if I were moving about, so I decided to try these wrap around headphones. I absolutely love them! They are very comfortable and give the added security that I wanted. They stay in place no matter what activity I do. I'm not an audiophile, but the sound quality to me is fantastic whether listening to music or podcasts. They are not noise cancelling, but they certainly block out normal distracting sounds while still allowing you to hear anything that you need to be alerted to. The longest I have worn them is 4 hours so I cannot say if they would work for someone who needs to use them for longer stretches. I have used them daily for well over a week and am just now charging them for the first time so they have good longevity on a charge. They connect easily to my iPhone, iPad, and Grace Digital internet radio. Some people may feel the need to spend a lot more money to get the highest sound quality possible, but these are more that adequate for the average user and the price for what you get is phenomenal.

title: Battery life - what kind of witchcraft is this?!
text:
Verified Purchase
I read the description of these headphones and didn't believe the battery life they advertised, mainly because I wear my headphones in Bluetooth mode between 18-20 hrs a day. I figured that I probably use headphones more rigorously than the average user but even with a fraction of the advertised battery life, I'd still be happy.
I bought them in late 2021 (November-ish) and it's now late February and they have completely performed as advertised. I legitimately only have to charge these things 1x week (some times less frequently)! And they really do charge really quickly!
I'm not a sound expert but I take phone calls on them all the time and haven't had any kind of problem with them for that (I have had that with other BT headphones before), I use them for everything from watching YouTube, listening to music & listening to Podcasts to taking online work meetings across multiple apps. I rarely need to but I've had it connected to both my phone and laptop at the same time as well. I've only used the "EQ" setting a couple of times but it took the song I was listening to from just regular & audible to feeling like I was surrounded with the music. It works well with audio that is made to sound like it's coming from different angles, too. I've even been watching something on my phone and heard a sound that I never noticed before but forgot I was wearing headphones and thought the sound was coming from the room I was in.
I think they're really good for the price based on the battery life alone and am really glad that I tried them before spending wayyy more on a designer brand.

title: Good quality for little price
text:
Verified Purchase
I have been using these for a little over a week and I must say that I really like them for the overall sound quality. My job does not allow me to move around a lot so for me the buds stay in perfect place for the day. I did notice that when I run however they feel a bit top heavy and have a tendency to work themselves out of my ear. The case is nice and solid and so are the buds. To me they do not feel cheap even though the price is low. The battery last longer than I thought they would and I only change about every three days and use them about 9 hours a day. Not sure how long that is going to last but I will go the long haul.
The audio quality is better than I expected, noise cancellation is passive however I did find that the jumps in volume are a little more steep than I expected. You have to mess with the up and down volume control to get it dialed in perfect. If the company made a app that allowed for some fine tune adjustments like volume steps and EQ that would be a great plus.
Overall sound is good with little outside interference. With lower volume you can hear cars and some wind noise while out side but one bump up it's completely gone.
The case that charges the buds is good and it does charge fast. Led indicators display battery level and they fit secure for changing. These are awesome buds for the price. The over all quality is very good. I would not suggest these for active distance runners because they have a tendency to loosen but for everyday activity they are a great value.

title: BOLOXA does it again!
text: The A17 Bluetooth Headphones Stereo Sound by Boloxa has really given me a better option in headphones. Low profile while in the ear and the charging cradle is straight forward, connect it to a USB port and forget about it. I have a variety of Bluetooth headphones, from over the ear to in the ear to sports and these A17 do bring these styles into one. I enjoy switching from each style depending on the environment I'm in (office/home) and now that these A17 have a combined style I can stick to using 1 longer, especially with the long battery life. One of the major features I like about these is that each unit comes with a control button which means I can pause the music from either my left ear or the right ear and continue with the other unit. Also switching to next or previous songs while playing music is as simple as touching the correct unit. The price is right at the market value as well, I can't wait to see what they (Boloxa) have coming in the future.

title: Nice Headphones, Good Value
text:
First let me say if your're looking to replace a $200 set of headphones and expect the same sound quality, then these probably aren't for you.
However, if your looking for a good quality set of headphones for a great price then these will meet your needs.
The headphones come nicely packaged and include the earbuds, charging case, charging cable and 3 sizes of eartips.
The headphones are well built. The earbuds fit nicely and are very comfortable. The over the ear design ensures that earbuds won't pop out during workouts.
The setup was very simple. Remove the earbuds from the case. Open the bluetooth settings on your phone, find the A17 headphones in the list, then click on them and pair. I was connected in a few seconds.
The sound quality on these are on par with other low end earbuds. They are great for Phone calls, Audio books and podcasts. When listening to music I found the the bass to be lacking for my preferences. . The sound was a bit tinny. However for listening to podcasts or audio books they were great.
These are a nice set of headphones for the price.

title: Holy Cow, These Are Great!
text:
Verified Purchase
I eager to help you find a good quality item. I came in to buy these with pretty low expectations considering the price range. But I have been very impressed with the quality of them.
These full wireless earbuds have great functionality. The buttons are very intuitive and will automatically connected and disconnect from my device and I open and close the carrying case. The buttons are responsive and work very well. The noise is not incredible, but come on, at this price range you can't expect great noise quality. These are light weight and I have found they fit great in my ears. Don't worry if you have huge ear canals are very small ones, as they come with more sizes then I have ever seen come with ear buds, from giant to tiny. I have not tested them in water, though I am sure they will meet the criteria described in the item summary.
The case is one of my favorite features. It has a really nice feel and does not attract finger prints. It comes with a lanyard which I thought was a very nice touch. This case has lights that show the power level, making it easy to know when they need the be charged again. And, what I think might be the best feature for this case, the type c charging.
My one critique would be that the buttons take quite a bit of pressure the press. This is very nitpicky though, as it is not terrible, just a little inconvenient.

text:
I’ve been very impressed with this product so far.
The earbuds rest comfortably on my ears. Normally, I find that the plastic that encompasses my ears causes some soreness. So far, I have not encountered this issue. I like that these are relatively comfortable and unlike the large headphones that encapsulate your ears, these won’t make my ears all sweaty.
The volume setting is as expected and is on par with other headphones that I have used in the past. The clarity of my music is nice and I don’t notice any kind of feedback, fuzziness, or scratchiness. I think it could be a bit louder, but probably not good for my hearing long term.
The headset comes with a small charging station / dock in which you can place your earbuds when you are finished using them. Since we are dealing with electronics, I make sure the little metal pins used to charge each earbud are dry and free of debris. The case itself is a hard case, making it resistant to drop, bumps, or other mishaps.
Pairing the headset is relatively quick and the instructions were very clear.
There are two ways to turn off the headset: either by docking each earbud or by holding the buttons on each headset. One thing I figured out is that they won’t power off via the button press while music is playing, so one will need to turn that off first in order to power down the unit. The headset will automatically turn on when removed from the docking station. I don’t see this as a downside because if I am taking them out, I plan on using them.
While charging you can see how much battery life is left on the headset when you dock the earbuds. I find this pretty useful so that I don’t overcharge my electronics. Each charge seems to last between 6 to 12 hours at full volume. This may change if one is on the phone the entire time.
While using the headset to speak or communicate, the person I am speaking with is able to hear me clearly. I don’t have to worry about positioning a microphone, which is nice.
Overall, I really like this product and it provides an excellent value for what is provided.
name: Devin

title: Wonderful headphone - but one major issue
text:
Verified Purchase
These headphones are absolutely wonderful. Sound is great. battery life is great. fit is great. I ran into absolutely no issues the first month I owned them. . but then - my Peloton arrived.
These will not work with the Peloton. They skip constantly, they won't stay connected, the crackle, I can't use them. Any other set of bluetooth earbuds works great - these are the only ones in the house that won't work. I have no idea why, ABSOLUTELY could be user error, but i've tried everything. So just be warned.
They worked on the ipad, the surface pro, my PC, macbook, iphone 8, iphone x. . . just not the bike.

text: These boloxa a17 earbuds are so comfortable I forgot I was wearing them! title: They are the best earbuds I have ever used!
text:
Verified Purchase
I use this product to listen to music, podcast, and audio books. I absolutely love these earbuds. I love that I can take a shower while wearing my earbuds I love that I don't have to worry about if they get wet in the rain walking to and from my car. The ability to use one earbud or two is great for me. The battery life for the Bebens are quite impressive My fiance has a pair of earbuds from a DIFFERENT brand (which is what made me want a pair of wireless earbuds) and his are nice and three times the price of mine but his battery life sucks he can't work a whole 10-12hour shift without his going dead. He can't shower with his and he has to use both earbuds or the right sided earbud which may not seem like a big deal but it's a huge plus to just grab one and go and do crafts with the kids and not worry if I got the right one. His earbuds also have a very short range In distance. He pretty much has to keep his phone on him or what he is listening to will come and go in the earbud.
I'm buying him a pair of Bebens just to have for work because the battery life. Like I said before the ones he has now are way more costly but can't do the same things as mine and I have used his earbuds before mine arrived and there is no difference in sound. I actually prefer my earbuds over his, the Bebens are more comfortable , stay in place better, has a longer distance in range so I can leave my phone on the deck and wash my car and not lose sound.
I also haven't had one problem with talking on the phone while using my earbuds both parties can hear great. The only thing I wish Bebens had where color options. Other then that I'm very pleased with my earbuds and will be a company I follow and if I ever need new earbuds this company will be my first stop. I have learned two things. One wireless earbuds are a must have and just because something is more expensive doesn't mean they are going to work any better then something half the price and it doesn't make them any fancier just because they were more money. Mine were half the price of his and all around work better and has better perks then his.
I can't wait for the other ones I ordered to get here. I couldn't help myself I had to buy him a pair,my twin,and my daughter a pair

title: Good bargain!
text:
Verified Purchase
[EDIT: By default it will connect to the last paired device when you turn it on. To UNpair the headphones without accessing the last paired device, press both the forward (AKA '+') and backward (AKA '-') buttons at the same time. You will hear the message "disconnected" and the light will blink blue and red. In the instructions they describe this as "resetting" the headphones in the "Other Function" part at the end.]
The sound quality is wonderful and I love the equalizer feature. They feel very comfortable - the padding also reduces the amount of sound that nearby folks can hear. Unlike some rechargeable Bluetooth devices that also support calls, the remaining battery percentage appears on the phone's Bluetooth screen (which prevents unnecessary charging). I haven't tested the battery life, but if it's anywhere near what the seller says (70 hours) then these are a great buy. Don't forget that they're foldable for easier storage when traveling.
However I do find myself taking them off when I need to use the buttons. I seem to end up accidentally powering it off sometimes. That could just be me: it might be time to put my fat thumbs on a diet.

title: Great item. Super quality sound and battery life.
text:
Verified Purchase
Love it! I have several True wireless earbuds in the house including some major name brand that costs couple of hundred bucks but so far this one is my go to pair. My biggest issue I've had in the past with these type earbuds are that they don't stay in the ear for long during an extreme workout. They seem to move around a bit once I sweat during a dynamic workout and would have to keep adjusting them. I can say that this one is different as it fits like a glove and you won't notice them on after couple of minutes you put them on as they're comfortable. The sound is great and volume can go pretty high without sounding horrible. I like that it can be worn on either side. I mean the one that says L fits just the same on R and vise versa. This is perfect for me since I can switch them because I prefer to wear only one while running on the roads on my left ear more than the right. The feature I like is audible notification on these. Comes with 6 sets of earplugs so you can be assure one of them will gives you a right fit. Battery life is impressive. I've had this for about 5 hours non stop on music and about 8 hours on standby mode and so far and haven't had to put back in case to recharge yet.
I prefer the click button type as I don't have to worry about accidental clicks with touch type. Friends say I sound clear when I'm on the phone with them so it's a plus.
Try them on. You'll like it.

title: Wow! Better Than Others I've Tried
text:
Verified Purchase
This is my third pair of headphones that are similar to these. All I can say is WOW! I only got them this afternoon but I've been using them. The sound quality is better than others I have tried, specifically the bass. For the price you can't go wrong on these, I wouldn't hesitate to buy another pair. As far as battery life goes, I typically don't listen for too terribly long before I'm done. But I've listened for almost 2 hours and they were still going when I put them back in the case. They fit in the ear well with the correct adjustments. They have buttons on the side to stop, play, skip forward/back, answer calls, etc. However the left one does something different than the right...just a bit strange to get use to but I'm sure it will be second nature when I start using them more.
Instructions say they will work swimming/shower/rain. I'd be a bit nervous to use them for personal reasons while swimming...would hate for them to get ruined. They say not to use them diving but I'd assume if you put your head under water you'd be ok. I hope they last a long time and if not they are backed by a decent warranty for a set of headphones. As long as the company follows through with any issues that might creep up I am happy. Overall great quality and a sweet charging case..it even vibrates when you plug it in. I thought that was cool.

title: Great sound quality, noise cancelling, and comfortable wireless headphones!
text:
Verified Purchase
I’ve been using my wireless earbuds for the past couple of days and love them!
Comfort/Fit: The earbuds are very cozy and sometimes I forget they are in. It took a couple of times testing out the different sizes of earbud caps to find the perfect fit. They provide you with many different cap sizes which is great.
Bluetooth Distance: The distance you can travel away from your phone is great. I don’t have an exact measurement but I’ve tried them out with chores around the house and they were able to remain connected to my phone, even if I left it downstairs and was cleaning the upstairs. I would estimate their range from my phone is more like 20-30 feet, possibly a little further.
Sound Quality/Noise Cancelling: I think the sound quality is great. The noise-canceling is almost too good. If I have my volume on low, it seems to cancel out most of the noise and I usually need to pause the sound or take one earbud out to hear the person.
Battery life: I charged the battery on the day I received it and it had lasted me for the past 3 days. I’ve probably used it for about 4-5 hours total and the charging case is only down to 2/4 bars.
Setup ease: I had some difficulty where only one earbud connected originally. This was not a big problem because they provide step by step instructions in case this happens. It was easy to resolve and I was all set up in about 5 minutes with no further connectivity issues.
Additional Thoughts: I wanted to test these out during a workout and found that they stayed in my ears. A few times they felt a little loose, but they never fell out through jump squats or planking.

title: Bike Riders Take Note!!
text: I ride an average of 400 miles a month. I need sports headphones that are TOUGH, that have enough battery for a 100 KM ride, that stay in my ears over the most challenging terrain, that provide high quality sound so that whatever I play, I can hear it clearly. The BOLOXA A17 Bluetooth Headphones excel in every one of these requirements. Yesterday I finished a 60 mile gravel ride. These headphones performed like magic. For the first hour and a half I listened to the Eric Metaxas biography of Dietrich Bonhoeffer. Didn't miss a word. For the rest of the ride I listened to my Grateful Dead channel. The base midrange and treble were ALL delivered with great fidelity. The batteries were still operating after nearly 3 hours and the earbuds stayed in and delivered without blocking the surrounding sounds which is a great safety factor. It was nearly 100 degrees by the end and I was dripping with sweat but the WATERPROOF earphones continued to operate, unbothered by the sweat. These earphones did everything I could possibly ask of them, delivered terrific quality sound and remained comfortable for the entire ride. If you are looking for world class sound that is reliable and long lasting, I have never experienced anything better. Get yourself a pair of BOLOXA A17 Bluetooth Headphones. They may be the last sport earphones you ever buy!!

title: Wireless Earbuds for Fitness Enthusiasts!
text:
If you're a fitness enthusiast like me, searching for the perfect earbuds for your workout sessions, look no further! These wireless earbuds have been a game-changer for me, and I couldn't be happier with my purchase.
Firstly, the waterproof feature is a game-changer for gym-goers who tend to sweat profusely during workouts. I used to worry about sweat ruining my earbuds, but these earbuds are built to withstand the toughest workouts and intense perspiration. Sweat all you want, and they'll stay perfectly functional, no matter how intense your exercise routine is!
The Hi-Fi sound quality is simply outstanding. Every beat and note come through crystal clear, enhancing my workout experience to a whole new level. The immersive audio motivates and energizes me, making those intense training sessions feel effortless.
One feature I genuinely adore is the button control. As someone who works out in gloves, I've struggled with touch controls on other earbuds. But with these, I can easily manage my music, calls, and even access voice assistants without any hassle. It's perfect for quick adjustments during my workouts, allowing me to stay focused and in the zone.
Overall, these wireless earbuds have exceeded my expectations in every aspect. They are an excellent choice for gym enthusiasts who demand durability, exceptional sound, and user-friendly controls. If you're looking for earbuds that won't disappoint during your fitness journey, I highly recommend giving these a try. They've become an essential part of my workout routine, and I'm sure they'll become your go-to workout companion too!

title: Clear voice quality and great fit - No fall
text:
They come with different-sized ear tips to ensure a secure and comfortable fit for various ear shapes and sizes. The lightweight construction, combined with the ergonomic design, ensures that the earbuds stay in place during workouts, daily commutes, or extended listening sessions. You can wear them for hours without experiencing any discomfort or fatigue. I recommend getting another pair for my family.
One of the standout features of the Boloxa A17 is its wide and balanced frequency response. Whether you're a fan of bass-heavy beats or prefer the crisp clarity of high notes, these headphones deliver exceptional audio performance across the entire sound spectrum. The sound quality is rich, immersive, and highly satisfying, making it an absolute joy to listen to music, podcasts, or any other audio content.
Connection is easy and reliable. Unlike a few others, these don’t randomly disconnect or go to “Pause”. It also offers a very decent range – I can easily walk from one floor to another floor down the hallway to the other side and very rarely do I lose connection.
the Boloxa A17 earbuds provide approximately 5 hours of playback time on a single charge. The included charging case extends the usage time by providing multiple additional charges on the go. Pairing the earbuds with your Bluetooth-enabled devices is a breeze, and the connection remains stable within a reasonable range, ensuring uninterrupted music playback and hands-free calling.
There are two ways to turn off the headset: either by docking each earbud or by holding the buttons on each headset. One thing I figured out is that they won’t power off via the button press while music is playing, so one will need to turn that off first in order to power down the unit. The headset will automatically turn on when removed from the docking station. I don’t see this as a downside because if I am taking them out, I plan on using them.
The only improvement I wish for is a slight tweak in design so that both earbuds can allow volume up and down instead of the left earbud for volume down and the right for volume up. Also, it would be good battery/charging display is on the outside of the case. Other than that, I’m extremely satisfied and do plan on gifting this true gem to friends and family.

title: AMAZING.
text:
Verified Purchase
I go to college in Boston, and my campus is about half a mile from where I live so I walk to and from every day and sometimes on weekends for studying. Same for my job; it's right around the corner. Earbuds with wires tend to be too much clutter and tangle easily, so I purchased those primarily for that purpose. And then COVID-19 hit, so now I'm wearing a mask all the time. Wires become even more of a nuisance.
The positive reviews were hyping up the bass of these earbuds, as well as noise cancelling, etc. and I truthfully wasn't expecting any of that to be super good considering the price. I just needed them to walk around the city without wires. But wow!! As soon as I put them in, even without putting music on yet, they were SO noise cancelling. I have a toddler living in my household, and he's in his terrible twos, so I'm constantly hearing screaming. I heard almost nothing!! When I put music on, at 50% volume I could comfortably hear the music with minimal background noise. I also listen to several genres of music (classical, opera, pop, R&B, rock, alternative, some country, etc.), so I tested them out for each. Bass was perfect where there was some, all songs were clear and crisp, and nothing was muffled. Because of this, I also started using them while exercising. I have a running, weight lifting, and yoga regimen and they don't fall out at all. The music is still clear. But like any earbud, your ears get sore a little bit after a while. That's my only complaint though. Battery life is perfect, the case is super durable, and overall very travel friendly. 10/10 recommend!!!

title: Great value! Easy to control
text: I received my BOLOXA A17 Bluetooth Headphones a few days ago and I’ve had the chance to use them in several different situations. Sitting in my office, they are great for work calls - clear sound and easy to control - volume up, volume down, next/previous track, answer, etc. Walking my dog, same story - easy to adjust volumes and mute/unmute. No issues with fit or keeping them in place. This is a particularly good feature when doing anything that involves a little more movement - other buds I have tried tended to move or fall out when I was jogging or working out - these stay in place. No issues with getting them wet from a little sweat either. Charging is super simple in the case and I have found that I get better battery life than I have seen with other buds. So far, I have charged them once and it seems like I will only need to charge about once per week at my normal usage rate. For the price, it would be hard to beat these headphones. I recommend!

title: Solid bang for buck!
text:
Verified Purchase
First, let's look at the price. In a world of "you get what you pay for," these ignore that completely. These could easily sell for a bit more. I bought these on impulse and am not reviewing from an "audiophile" standpoint, but from the "I want music when I hit the treadmill, walk my dog, or go skiing" standpoint. So far, so good.
I've had these headphones for 3 full days and have put them through some paces. Podcasts, phone calls, music - while exercising, walking my dog, or driving (one ear for phone calls). The earbuds came with a number of different sizes of adapters; I have abnormally large ear canals and they fit awesomely. I can't wear Apple Airpods or the headphones that come with Apple devices as they fall right out.
I have three tiny complaints that I would consider more "imperfections" than I would problems:
1. The seal is SO GOOD when they're connected, that even when the music is paused, I can hardly hear my surroundings. I need to take one out to talk to people or to be aware of traffic when I'm out on the street.
2. Despite that seal being great, the "angle" of the earbud is tough to determine when they're in my ears. That said, once I get them in, they don't really move.
3. I didn't read the directions, so it's my fault in part that I went to use them and one of the earbuds died on me. Turns out that when I put them in the charging case, I need to pop the button on each of them to charge. Lesson learned, for sure, but it's one of those things that, to me, should just be that it charges when you put it in the case.
Sound quality isn't bad! I was nervous when the "pairing" dialogue wasn't in time, but the music and spoken word worked marvelously. I listened to songs that had heavy panning and each ear delivered sound in a percieveably well-balanced manner. The standard EQ isn't too bass-heavy.
tl;dr: Great headphones for the money. The only problems aren't really problems.

title: Very Pleasantly Surprised
text:
Been trying out many, many different sports-oriented wireless earbuds over the past two years (occiam, apekx, okeefe, Tozo, etc., you name it). Over numerous disappointments and many frustrating experiences, took a flyer on this relatively new product and I’m very glad I did. Across all the ones I’ve tried in this price range, this one by far is the best. A few highlights below:
1) Sound quality is up there even against mainstream brand products that that boast noise-canceling features such as Beats and Skull Candy (by the way, way overrated). Music is crisp, podcasts are clear and it responds quite well when I was toying around with equalizer apps on my phone. No issues with phone calls even in crowded public spaces.
2) Connection is easy and reliable. Unlike my experience with Tozo and a few others, these don’t randomly disconnects or goes to “Pause”. It also offers a very decent range – I can easily walk from my desk down the hallway to the other side and very rarely do I lose connection.
3) Battery life is quite amazing. Instead of having to charge every other night before going to bed, these can easily last me almost and entire week just using the case to charge during showers and meetings. I pretty much wear them all the time – during my commute, at work, in gyms, out running errands, etc.
4) The earpieces are very comfortable to wear all day, and unlike a few others do not fall off. I also very much appreciate the big, round buttons controls on the side. They are easy to reach / find, do not require much effort to press, and most importantly not based on touch sensors where I can accidentally drop a call or stop a track when I’m just making slight adjustments or taking one side off.
5) This is one of the very few models that come with wireless charging, and it works quite well. No need to frequently adjust the positioning to make it work.
The only improvement I wish for is a slight tweak in design so the battery / charging display is on the outside of the case. Other than that, I’m extremely satisfied and do plan on gifting this true gem to friends and family this Christmas season.
One last note…for these type of everyday use earbuds, anything IPX 5 / IPX 6 or above is more than adequate (and this is IPX 7). Paying more for IPX 8 is total overkill and not worth the extra costs.

title: GOOD SOUND - GOOD COVERAGE - COMFORTABLE - LONG PLAYING
text:
These WILLMOOD Bluetooth over the ear headphones are a well designed, well made product.
They paired quickly with my computer with Windows 10 Pro operating system. They also paired quickly with my wireless phone, Android system.
The next important feature that I checked was the sound quality. How will your favorite music sound?
They have a very smooth response range, and they have mode button that will allow you to make subtle changes jin the response curve in accordance with your personal liking,. They have a full sound with full bassl, and if you should desire more base simply hit the mode button for a boost.
I listened to a few of my favorites. Some Berlioz, 'Willy', and Bon Jovi.
From that test I am well satisfied that these headphones could put sound in my ears all day without causing listening fatigue, or discomfort from wearing them for long hours at a time.
They are as the details say, lightweight and comfortable. They conform to your ears.
The fold away feature is really nice for travel or storage.
Again, well designed and very simple functionality.
These are described as headphones and that is their primary purpose but if you need to take a call or instigate a call they do have a microphone function. Not great sounding, not suitable for a podcast but plenty good for phone calls. That is an added bonus to the versatility of this wireless set.
advertised or described as a headset then of course the quality of voice reproduction then it would be fair game for a slight negative rating, but as it is, this is a plus, a bonus feature.
I could not find any location within my apartment where there was a music dropout. Not even when I put my head and headphones were far into the refrigerator with the door acting as a metal shield between myself and my computer. Great Bluetooth coverage.
This is an excellent performer both for sound and battery life.
I have had them playing for over thirty five hours and have noticed no change in quality of sound or coverage. I don't doubt that seventy hours from a full charge is a realistic claim.
I am listening to a performance of "Harold In Italy" where the Pilgrims March has just begun.
In my opinion this is a super value for those wanting to be untethered from a computer desk, and to experience the freedom of wirless music listenihng and commlunications.
Modest price, major performance, equals a very fine value.
True to their description.
I am rating these WILLMOOD Bluetooth headphones five big stars. I cannot feature for the low price anyone experiencing disappointment with this item.

title: One earbud won't hold a charge
text:
Verified Purchase
Update:
After seeing my review, Beben offered to send a replacement, which arrived quickly. The product looked the same. I wanted to give them a fair evaluation so I charged them over night. Then I didn't have a chance to use them for several days, mostly because I was not home. Beben emailed me on June 28th and 30th, and July 2nd, 6th, and 8th to request that I remove my review. That doesn't seem right. But an update seems fair.
The earbuds and charger look good. They're fairly comfortable even for small ears, and came with several rubbery earbud covers to fit well. They also have a convenient charger cable to connect to my laptop or USB wall outlet charger. Nice case. Arrived in good condition. Holds a charge for at least two hours. Pairs and connects well and stays connected, until I walk about 20' away from the paired device, when the sound cuts in and out, but didn't disconnect even when I walked from the back bedroom to the kitchen. Overall, I'm satisfied with the product and the price.
Original Review:
Everything works except one earbud won't hold a charge. Beben suggested trying a different cable and port, which is nonsensical, but I did it. I also tried switching them in the charging case, which didn't help. The earbud is defective. Here's what they look like after charging for 24 hours, again.
Looks good. Fairly comfortable even for small ears. Nice case. Arrived in otherwise good condition.
I saw other reviews/questions regarding earbuds not charging. Took a chance on them. Disappointed in the product and customer service, and wouldn't recommend.

title: Great sound quality, battery life, and decent noise cancellation, but very glitchy connection
text:
Verified Purchase
For the price these are pretty nice. Good build quality, suprisingly good sound, and satisfying battery life. The buds themselves fit comfortably in the ear and do not fall out during strenuous activity. But for some reason the connection to my phone breaks up randomly and repeatedly during use, especially when my phone is in my pocket but pretty much any time. Very irritating. Also, the right bud does not sync with the left Bud's volume and is quieter half of the time, and the touch controls occasionally don't work when double tapping.
UPDATE: The company contacted me personally after seeing my review. They explained it was a defective pair of buds and offered to either refund me or send me a new pair for free. Very kind and considerate customer service. I accepted the new pair. They work near perfectly. Same pros as with the first pair, but I do still experience some interference while doing hard work, in construction. 95% of the time they work perfect and I can only assume the glitches are a product of busy surroundings, there are many things to interfere with the connection. In all other cases they work as they should and meet my expectations well.

title: Looks and sounds good
text:
These earbuds are truly impressive and I have used quite a few. The design in black is sleek and modern, making them quite the stylish accessory. What's particularly good is their ability to stay securely in place during sports activities or while commuting on a bus or bike – a practical feature for us on-the-go folks.
The sound quality is quite exceptional, thanks in part to the ear tips that effectively block out ambient noise, elevating the overall music experience. The design choice to offer extra support behind the ears results in a slightly larger case, which is easily forgiven once you realize it supports wireless charging. Charging convenience is always a plus, right?
In conclusion, I can confidently recommend these earbuds. If you're a fellow enthusiast of running or active lifestyles, these earbuds could be your perfect companions. They strike a fine balance between style, functionality, and great sound.
christopher daugherty
5.0 out of 5 stars Great for the Gym
Reviewed in the United States on August 9, 2023
These earbuds are great for working out. I weight lift and had trouble with AirPods falling out several times. The over the rad attachment was too expensive to make sense for me to buy after spending so much on the AirPods themselves. These earbuds are great quality for the money and exactly what I needed for the gym.
AirPods are basically the same but for ten times the price. These are much more affordable and practical for my budget. I do not need the most expensive, most popular earbuds when I am going to use them at the gym and get them sweaty and gross. This brand is reliable and makes good value products for the money. I will definitely buy their earbuds in the future. Buying products like this on Amazon is much more affordable than buying products from electronic stores or the mall. Will definitely buy from seller again.

title: Boloxa A17 Bluetooth Earbuds Review - Your Buds for Sound and Comfort!
text:
I just got my hands on the Boloxa A17 Bluetooth Earbuds and am pretty excited to have these as my day to day ear buds. If you're all about hassle-free sound, music and comfort, keep reading.
The wireless charging case is a bit bigger than others that I've had but it's actually a great thing because I no longer am I going to go digging through my bag for a small case that's fallen to the bottom. Not only does the case keep your earbuds safe but it also shows how much juice they've got left with a large digital display.
Now, sound quality. I put on my favorite playlists on spotify and was blown away. The sound is clear as day, with some serious bass punch. Whether you're into music, podcasting or simply watching TV shows, these buds deliver the fantastic sound. Battery life is pretty amazing as well. I wore these through a workout session as well as many hours of netflix and hulu episodes throughout the evening and they didn't even break a sweat. Perfect for long commutes or even binge-watching sessions.
Oh, and they're waterproof. Not like "Oops, it got wet" waterproof – we're talking IPXX7 waterproof. Rain or sweat, these earbuds can take it. I actually put these on in the pool and have hung out for several hours without an issue - they sound the same after the fact. Let's not forget about those ear hooks. The wraparound earhooks are a game-changer. They're comfy, and they stay put. Whether you're on a brisk walk, maybe even jogging or just chilling, these earbuds won't casually pop out of your ears, as many have for me.
So all in all, I have to say that the Boloxa A17 Bluetooth Earbuds are a great deal. They are easy to operate, can withstand a lot of wear and probably tear (with the way I use things) and appear super sleek on your head. Put it all together with the wireless charging case, killer sound, long battery life, and snug fit, they're a no-brainer. Upgrade your music listening or video watching game with these buds – you won't regret it.

I just got my hands on the Boloxa A17 Bluetooth Earbuds and am pretty excited to have these as my day to day ear buds. If you're all about hassle-free sound, music and comfort, keep reading. The wireless charging case is a bit bigger than others that I've had but it's actually a great thing because I no longer am I going to go digging through my bag for a small case that's fallen to the bottom. Not only does the case keep your earbuds safe but it also shows how much juice they've got left with a large digital display. Now, sound quality. I put on my favorite playlists on spotify and was blown away. The sound is clear as day, with some serious bass punch. Whether you're into music, podcasting or simply watching TV shows, these buds deliver the fantastic sound. Battery life is pretty amazing as well. I wore these through a workout session as well as many hours of netflix and hulu episodes throughout the evening and they didn't even break a sweat. Perfect for long commutes or even binge-watching sessions. Oh, and they're waterproof. Not like "Oops, it got wet" waterproof – we're talking IPXX7 waterproof. Rain or sweat, these earbuds can take it. I actually put these on in the pool and have hung out for several hours without an issue - they sound the same after the fact. Let's not forget about those ear hooks. The wraparound earhooks are a game-changer. They're comfy, and they stay put. Whether you're on a brisk walk, maybe even jogging or just chilling, these earbuds won't casually pop out of your ears, as many have for me. So all in all, I have to say that the Boloxa A17 Bluetooth Earbuds are a great deal. They are easy to operate, can withstand a lot of wear and probably tear (with the way I use things) and appear super sleek on your head. Put it all together with the wireless charging case, killer sound, long battery life, and snug fit, they're a no-brainer. Upgrade your music listening or video watching game with these buds – you won't regret it.

title: Impressed!
text:
Verified Purchase
I ordered these primarily to use for workouts and to listen to music while studying. I had been looking into getting some quality true wireless earbuds for a while, but quite honestly I did not want to make the investment in AirPods. I think AirPods are all hype, especially after trying these earbuds out.
Pros:
- The sound quality was amazing and I was extremely impressed by the bass quality on these things. I listen to a wide variety of music genres but I am definitely a fan of songs with some bass in it, and these allowed me to enjoy such songs. I did not experience this with the AirPods
- The charging case and the earbuds themselves are super sleek. The earbuds magnetically connect to the charging case and the charging case also closes magnetically
- I was also surprised with how well a job these did with noise cancelling. I couldn't hear anybody talking to me while I had them in
- Pairing was super simple initially and now they connect automatically once I take them out of the case and automatically turn off once I replace them back in the case
- Siri and other command functions are very convenient
Cons:
- I was surprised with the fact there were command functions on these earbuds but I couldn't imagine someone who had hands any bit bigger than I did being able to use the tiny buttons with ease
- Talking on the phone I could hear the other person OK but my voice sounded mumbled
All in all these are an amazing alternative to AirPods for someone who wants totally wireless earbuds that are good quality, without the expense of AirPods. The only thing missing that the Airpods have are the little image that pops up on your device when pairing and they automatically pause when you take them out of your ear. If you can live without that and are just looking for quality wireless earbuds then these are for you!

title: A good bluetooth earbud with some connection issues. *UPDATED*
text:
Verified Purchase
I want to start this by saying I use this mainly in MONO mode, which is basically only using one earbud at a time. I find it rude to have both in when I am working so I only use one, and if one runs out of batteries I can just switch to the other.
I usually use another brand which no longer is being made or is currently unavailable. So I was on the lookout for a new set. I washed my old ones or lost one by accident...its always something that makes me replace them. They never died and they were work horses and I loved them.
https://www.amazon.com/ELIPHONIC-Bluetooth-Headphones-Sweatproof-Microphone/dp/B07K8RW959
That's the link to the ones I am talking about, these had the same kind of feel to the ones I had before with the ability to work in mono mode (they don't all do this)...and honestly this one doesn't really work well in mono mode either. *UPDATED* - I originally had issues with it not switching without me resetting the bluetooth settings, because it uses the same connection. While it still only uses one connection instead of two for each ear, the problem seem to have gone away and it connects properly, so I added a star.
Also, they occasionally will drop the connection. I don't know why. The phone is not moving, I am right next to it...but I lose the connection. It will reconnect in a few seconds, but it's still annoying. *UPDATED* This is still an issue. It happens maybe once or twice a day and it's a minor inconvenience. However that's why I took the star off for this.
I give it four stars because the sound is nice, and I like the case. It has magnets that will lock the earbud in place and there is a light on the earbud that shows when it is charging. *UPDATED* The loss of connection is what made me give it 4 out of 5 stars.

title: A True Sports Companion
text:
I recently purchased the BOLOXA A17 Bluetooth Headphones, and I must say, they have exceeded my expectations in every way! As someone who enjoys an active lifestyle, I needed a pair of earphones that could keep up with me during sports activities, particularly running. These earphones have been a game-changer for my workout routine.
One of the standout features of the BOLOXA A17 is the charging case. The quality of the case is excellent, and it provides a secure and convenient way to store and charge the earphones. I love the added feature of being able to see the battery percentage on the case. It allows me to plan my workouts better and ensures that I never run out of juice during extended sessions.
When it comes to the earphones themselves, they are specifically designed for sports enthusiasts like me. The ear hooks are fantastic! They fit snugly and securely around my ears, guaranteeing that the earphones won't fall off no matter how intense my activities get. This level of stability is crucial, and it gives me the confidence to focus solely on my workouts without any distractions.
Connecting the earphones to my phone is a breeze. The Bluetooth pairing is lightning-fast, which means I spend less time fiddling with settings and more time enjoying my favorite tunes. The sound quality is surprisingly good for the price. The audio is clear, and the bass is punchy enough to keep me motivated throughout my entire run.
I also appreciate the durability of these earphones. They have endured a fair share of accidental drops and still work flawlessly. It's evident that BOLOXA has put a lot of thought into the design and construction of these headphones.
In conclusion, the BOLOXA A17 Bluetooth Headphones are a fantastic choice for sports enthusiasts and fitness fanatics. The charging case with the battery percentage indicator is a thoughtful addition, and the secure ear hooks ensure a worry-free workout experience. The quick and stable Bluetooth connection, along with the impressive sound quality, makes them a steal at this price point.
If you're looking for reliable, high-quality Bluetooth headphones that are perfect for sports, I highly recommend giving the BOLOXA A17 a try. They have truly become my go-to sports companion, and I couldn't be happier with my purchase!

title: Great Sound, Fabulous Battery Life
text:
Verified Purchase
1. Shape and Fit: 4.5 out of 5 stars
Who cares if a set of earbuds sound phenomenal but you can't stand to have them in your ears??? These come with a variety of rubber covers to make as comfortable a fit as possible, and the buds themselves are a kind of tear-drop shape that you can twist to sit in whatever direction needed. They are a tiny bit bulky if you're using them at night while you're trying to fall asleep but they are WAY Better than even the smaller, elbow shaped buds I've used before. They can sit snug but even so, they can still fall out of your ear eventually with a lot of movement, so I have to readjust regularly while working out. Seems to be the bane of all buds, though...
2. Sound: 5+ stars
Crisp, clear, balanced, with good output for even those bad recordings. Call quality = excellent, and never had a problem with anyone hearing or understanding me, either. Perfect for music during my workouts and great for audio books!
3. Features: 5 stars
* Use one or both - love this!
* Crazy great range - I still get a connection outside, 50 feet from the house where I've forgotten my phone. :)
* Excellent battery life! I've listened all night! And the case as a power bank make these go for days!
* One tap to pause, answer, or hang up. Hold to power up or down (though they automatically do so when you take them out of or put them back into their case, respectively) and to adjust volume.
4. Bonus: No loud, obnoxious notifications indicating battery is low or that you need to charge. And great price! Best pair of buds I've owned.

title: Great waterproof earbuds for swimming/hot tub
text:
Verified Purchase
I bought these because I was looking for a set of earbuds that I could use while swimming and in the hot tub. These work very well for that. They fit my ear snugly (using the appropriately sized ear gels), the sound is great and the battery lasts for longer than I am in the pool or hot tub! I like the feel of a physical button on each ear bud since it makes a positive "click" feel so you know you have pressed the button. I really like the fact that the case has an internal battery that can give me a few full charges of the earbuds without having to recharge the case all the time. I can see that being really useful when I go to the beach and don't have a source of power nearby so that I can listen to music all day.
I wore the earbuds to bed to see how they feel when drifting off to sleep. They feel OK but protrude out of my ear a bit too much so that when I'm laying on my side, there is some pressure on my ear (could just be an issue with the shape of my ear). The other issue I had when trying to use these while going to sleep is that, paired with my iPhone, I can't get the volume down low enough so the minimal volume level is just a bit too loud to comfortably fall asleep to. But since these are not meant for sleeping, this is not a deal breaker for me. For daily use, the volume level and sound quality are great.

title: An ideal blend of function, form, and performance in a budget-friendly package
text:
The A17-series earbuds have clearly blended the best of prior models into a clean and well-functioning successor. Right out of the box, the quality shows with the case, which supports both wireless and USB-C charging, permits easy removal of the earbuds, and has a very nice heft & snap. The earbuds themselves are extremely comfortable, fit securely even during vigorous exercise, and paired straight-away. The new Bluetooth 5.3 chipset shows demonstrable advantages over the previous 4.0 standard with noticeably faster reconnection and reception - where an older BT4-based earbud would drop out due to distance or obstruction, the A17s keep going. I've been very happy with the sound quality - from audiobooks to classical to hard-hitting workout tracks, the audio came through clearly and with a full spectrum; you may want to swap the silicone earbud shields with one of the other sizes to tailor the fit, which allows for even better noise isolation and bass response. The headphone controls have a satisfying mechanical click, and are cleanly responsive. The true-wireless buds also synchronize nearly insantly when worn together, but function just as well when wearing a single earpiece at a time. The battery life is also fantastic - I get an entire day from the earbuds alone, and the case will charge them many times over!
Bottom line, if you're looking for robust sound & performance in a well-designed and comfortable package, and need something that is secure during physical activity, the A17 earbuds are a very easy choice that is just as easy on your wallet.

The A17-series earbuds have clearly blended the best of prior models into a clean and well-functioning successor. The earbuds themselves are extremely comfortable, fit securely even during vigorous exercise, and paired straight-away. The new Bluetooth 5.3 chipset shows demonstrable advantages over the previous 4.0 standard with noticeably faster reconnection and reception - where an older BT4-based earbud would drop out due to distance or obstruction, the A17s keep going. I've been very happy with the sound quality - from audiobooks to classical to hard-hitting workout tracks, the audio came through clearly and with a full spectrum; you may want to swap the silicone earbud shields with one of the other sizes to tailor the fit, which allows for even better noise isolation and bass response. The headphone controls have a satisfying mechanical click, and are cleanly responsive. The true-wireless buds also synchronize nearly insantly when worn together, but function just as well when wearing a single earpiece at a time. The battery life is also fantastic - I get an entire day from the earbuds alone, and the case will charge them many times over! Bottom line, if you're looking for robust sound & performance in a well-designed and comfortable package, and need something that is secure during physical activity, the A17 earbuds are a very easy choice that is just as easy on your wallet.

title: Outstanding BOLOXA A17 Bluetooth Headphones!
text:
*
I am absolutely thrilled with my purchase of the BOLOXA A17 Bluetooth Headphones. From the moment I unwrapped them, I knew I was in for a treat. The design is sleek and stylish, and the build quality feels premium.
The sound quality is simply outstanding. The headphones deliver crystal-clear audio with rich bass and crisp highs. Whether I'm listening to my favorite music or watching a movie, the immersive experience provided by these headphones is unparalleled.
The Bluetooth connectivity is seamless, and the wireless range is impressive. I can move around my house without any signal dropouts, which is incredibly convenient.
Comfort is key for me when it comes to headphones, and the BOLOXA A17 doesn't disappoint. The ear cups are soft and cushioned, and the adjustable headband ensures a snug fit. I can wear them for hours on end without any discomfort.
Battery life is excellent too. I've used them for extended periods, and they still had plenty of power left. Charging is quick and hassle-free.
On top of all that, the built-in microphone works flawlessly during phone calls, delivering clear voice quality to the other end.
Overall, the BOLOXA A17 Bluetooth Headphones have exceeded my expectations in every way. They offer a premium listening experience, comfort for extended use, and reliable functionality. I highly recommend them to anyone in need of top-notch Bluetooth headphones.
Chris H.
5.0 out of 5 stars Great value along with Quality for the price.
Reviewed in the United States on August 1, 2023
I bought this item (Boloxa A17) for working out, walking/biking/weight lifting. I wanted a push button control vs touch sensitive control. I have earbuds with sensitive touch control and it’s a pain to get it to work the way you want it to, this product (Boloxa A17) works and sounds great and you can easily adjust the volume up and down with ease. When needed you can also fast-forward or go back to songs with ease. The buttons on each ear piece makes it easy to control what you need it to do without the worry of trying to fumble around and push the wrong buttons. Very easy to adjust volume and change tracks on your music selection and answering and making calls. You also have two ways of charging, usb-c and wireless charging, which works great for my setup. I’ve worn these for up to 4 hours at a time with no issue as far as it hurting my ear canal or losing power. I like the way it hooks around the ear, it’s secure and I have no issues with it falling out. As for waterproof IPX67, I would say they definitely have been soaked from the use I’ve put them through including rinsing them off under the water spigot for cleaning and show no signs of failure. I would buy this product again!
